title.rendered: One&Only Cape Town: A New Reveal For The Ultra-Luxe Urban Resort

content.rendered:
On the edge of a private marina at the buzzing V&A Waterfront, enveloped by views of Table Mountain, One&Only Cape Town is a world-class resort that raises the bar when it comes to accommodation, amenities, wining and dining.

Despite its central location, the hotel feels far removed from the bustle of the city, offering guests a sense of discretion and seclusion – particularly on its palm-treed private “island”, home to a lagoon-like swimming pool (complete with four-poster cabanas), a poolside restaurant and a fabulous Bali-esque hydro-spa.

Foodies will be in their element with the only Nobu in Africa, famed for its Japanese-Peruvian fusion cuisine. For all-day dining, sophisticated drinks and high tea, the Vista Bar & Lounge at the heart of the resort has an iconic, picture-perfect view of Table Mountain. The modern, fresh and flavoursome plant-led menu was curated by renowned SA chef Karen Dudley. In addition, the Wine Studio offers a vast and beautifully curated collection of South African wines.

Naturally, the resort lays on a variety of additional leisure activities for guests, all designed to get the best out of a visit to this wonderful city, and has a great kids’ club to keep the younger ones delighted. With its ultra-luxe offering, superb hospitality and service, no wonder it’s become a bucket-list destination for discerning travellers (and celebrities, too).

A sense of place

A recent redesign and renovation has cemented its identity as South Africa’s only One&Only resort. Taking advantage of its location between mountain and sea, the decor and interiors celebrate nature, heritage and local craftsmanship.

Every space tells a story, filled with symbolism and connection. Table Mountain’s contours are mirrored in the patterns on carpets and earthy ceramics; the kelp forest in our ocean has inspired cushion fabrics and hand-carved mirror frames; the Cape’s unique fynbos flora blooms throughout the hotel.

African craft is echoed in beaded pots, basketry and traditional West African kente cloth; in gemstone shield headboards and the namji dolls (traditional good-luck charms) used as the “Do Not Disturb” signs. The legend of “The Watchers” (the story of the creation of Table Mountain) has been conveyed in a sculptural installation in the Vista Lounge & Bar, facing the mountain.

The lodgings

One&Only Cape Town offers a tranquil and luxurious hideaway on the doorstep of the city. Its 131 rooms and suites are known to be some of the most spacious in the city (a minimum size of 63 square metres), all with a private balcony or terrace and views of the surrounding waterways, Table Mountain and lush greenery.

  • 89 Marina or Island rooms (sleep 2 – 3 adults)
  • 40 Marina or Island suites (one or two bedrooms, sleep 2 – 6 adults)
  • 3 signature top-floor suites: Table Mountain (sleeps 2 – 3 adults); Presidential (sleeps 4 – 5 adults); Lion’s Head Penthouse (sleeps 8 adults)
  • breakfast included

Good to know As part of the One&Only’s “Summit & Sea” project, a percentage of the rate paid for staying in either of the Signature Suites goes to conservation. The Table Mountain Suite is aligned with the Endangered Wildlife Trust’s Threatened Amphibian Programme (helping to save the Table Mountain ghost frog), while The Presidential Suite is aligned with the Two Oceans Aquarium’s Turtle Conservation Centre.

Things to do at One&Only Cape Town

  • four restaurants, plus private dining options
  • wine-tastings, pairings and blending experiences on-site
  • swimming in the pool
  • paddleboarding in the private marina’s canals
  • spa treatments
  • guided trips to the Winelands, beaches, Table Mountain and more
  • animal encounters boat trip
  • yoga sessions
  • nature walks and hikes
  • learn to surf
  • explore the Waterfront

Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? Yes
Wifi? Yes
Cost From R11 145 per room
Contact 021 431 5800, reservations@oneandonlycapetown.com
Where to find it Dock Road, V&A Waterfront, Cape Town
MAKE A RESERVATION

title.rendered: White Water Farm: A Tranquil Country Escape Near Stanford

content.rendered:
Dating back to 1846, White Water Farm holds all the historic charm of an idyllic country retreat, while its modern-luxe lodgings (not to mention relative proximity to Cape Town) make it a sought-after destination.

The farm is named for Witblits, the Grappa-like liquor that used to be produced here, and the old distillery barn where the brew was produced remains intact.

Cows, alpacas, springboks, and donkeys roam across the 50 hectares of rolling pastures; gardens shaded by oak trees create an enchanting countryscape, while the Overberg mountains loom and the scent of hydrangeas lingers, making stays at this peaceful paradise in the the stuff of storybooks.

The lodgings

There are eight accommodations in total: three rooms (and an adjacent suite) in the farmhouse (parts of which date back to 1846), three suites in the old Dairy Barn, two suites in the Herb Barn, and one tastefully decorated cottage. Creature comforts in the rooms include a roaring fireplace, a porch with chairs overlooking the spectacular surrounds, and quaint teapots. Daily breakfast baskets (included in the rate) comprise fresh fruits, yogurt and cereal.

Farmhouse

  • two king-size en-suite bedrooms
  • one twin bed
  • one separate bathroom with a shower
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • open-plan lounge and dining room
  • indoor fireplace
  • private outdoor patio with a braai

Cost From R5 400 per night for the house (depending on season)

Farmhouse Deluxe Suite

  • one large bedroom with a king-size bed
  • open-plan lounge with a kitchenette
  • indoor fireplaces
  • two bathrooms
  • private courtyard with an outdoor shower

Cost From R2 200 per room per night (depending on season)

Gatehouse Cottage

  • open-plan interior
  • king-size four poster bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower
  • Victorian bath in the bedroom
  • open-plan lounge with a kitchenette
  • indoor fireplace
  • private outdoor patio

Cost R3 100 per room per night (depending on season)

Two Barn Suites

  • large bedroom with a king-size bed (can be made into twin beds)
  • en-suite bathroom with a large bath and shower
  • open-plan lounge with a kitchenette
  • indoor fireplace
  • single bed can be added

Cost From R1 900 per room per night (depending on season)

Three Dairy Suites

  • large bedroom with a king-size bed (can be made into twin beds)
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower
  • open-plan lounge with a kitchenette
  • indoor fireplace
  • single bed can be added

Cost From R1 650 per person per night (depending on season)

Things to do in the Stanford Valley

While you’re there, be sure to take a scenic stroll around the farm, passing the grazing farm animals along the way. In summer, you’ll want to spend loads of time at the pool pavilion, where a wonderful swimming and shaded gazebos await. There’s also mountain-biking, and hiking trails in the Phillipskop Private Mountain Reserve.

The nearby town of Stanford is home to a number of art galleries, cafés, and junkshops for all-day browsing. Oenophiles will be in heaven, with a scattering of wine estates close by that offer lunches and lovely tastings.

Distance from CT 2 hours
Child friendly? Yes, except for the Gatehouse Cottage
Children under two stay for free
Pet friendly? No
Cost From R1 650 – R5 400 per person per night (depending on unit and season)
Where to find it R326, Stanford, Western Cape

title.rendered: Fransvliet Guest House: A Serene Vineyard-Wrapped Guesthouse in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
If you’re headed to Franschhoek for the weekend, be it for a romantic getaway or a rendezvous with friends, you definitely want to be close to the action, but not necessarily in it.

Fransvliet Guest House is just the ticket. Flanked by a mountain range on either side, and surrounded by vineyards, the property is perfectly positioned, a five-minute drive from the buzzy town centre, on the R45 Main Road, with rows and rows of green, leafy vines evoking unhindered peace and privacy.

The lodgings

There are five guesthouse suites and two self-catering options (with a third Manor House in the pipeline). Each has its own private stoep overlooking a beautiful garden and the mountain beyond – ideal for unwinding with a glass of wine and enjoying the sunset in solitude. Inside, the rooms are modern and luxuriously comfortable, thanks to a fireplace and plush furnishings.

The Suites

  • 5 suites (namely The Chenin, The Cabernet, The Sauvignon, The Chardonnay, The Shiraz)
  • king-size bed
  • DStv
  • air-conditioning
  • fireplace
  • bath + walk-in shower
  • fridge
  • Nespresso machine

Cost From R2 800 per room per night (depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

Gardens Studio

  • double bed
  • fireplace
  • walk-in shower
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • DStv
  • air-conditioning
  • Nespresso machine
  • Weber braai

Cost From R2 800 for the studio per night (depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

The Villa at Fransvliet

  • 2 king-size beds
  • 2 fireplaces
  • 2 en-suite bathrooms with bathtubs + walk-in showers
  • 2 smart TVs
  • air-conditioning
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • Nespresso machine
  • Weber braai
  • private splash pool
  • private garden with entertainment area

Cost From R5 800 for the villa per night (depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

While you’re there…

Being on a working wine farm, a stroll through the vineyards and indigenous gardens comes highly recommended. For outdoor enthusiasts, there’s a network of walking, mountain-biking and hiking trails on and around the property. Bird watchers, keep your eyes peeled for the owls, kingfishers and hawks that live on and around the property.

Gourmands will be in their element, with a slew of restaurants and pavement cafés five minutes away.

Good to know Private dinner experiences for groups can be arranged for get-togethers with friends and family.
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Cost Suites From R2 800 (depending on season)
Garden Studio: From R2 800 (depending on season)
The Villa at Fransvliet: From R5 800 (depending on season)
Where to find it 45 Main Road, Le Roux, Franschhoek, Western Cape

title.rendered: Dorp Boutique Hotel: Heaven on the Hillside

content.rendered:
How to describe the delight that is Dorp Hotel. Un hôtel particulier, perhaps? Such places do not technically exist in the southern hemisphere; but then again, nothing quite like the Dorp exists anywhere else in the world.

The view alone is incomparable: Signal Hill, Table Mountain, the Bo-Kaap and City Bowl, the sweeping bay of Cape Town and the endless Atlantic Ocean. You can take it all in from the rooftop terrace, where you will also happen upon a small tomato greenhouse – complete with a chaise longue for lingering and reading (or writing) novels. Whimsical details abound at the Dorp, a hillside haven conceived and designed by the legendary late hotelier Gail Behr.

The lodgings

Each dreamy bedroom and every enchanting suite is unique and individually decorated. Some boast private steam rooms, others have kitchens, bar counters, wide-vista terraces or secret courtyards. The “worst room in the house” has the prettiest wallpaper on earth. All come with handmade linen dressing gowns in the perfect shade of strawberry sorbet, heaven-scented toiletries and bedside jars of midnight snacks (like Tex, Bar One and Jelly Tots). It’s as if your every whim has been anticipated. But if something you desire is not immediately at hand, you can request it from the Salon: anyone for a walking stick, yoga mat or hair straightener? The service, as you might expect, is superb. Your comfort and privacy are paramount.

  • ensuite bathroom with shower and/or bath
  • private terraces, patios and courtyard areas for select suites
  • pool access for select suites
  • fully equipped kitchens with Smeg appliances in select suites
  • underfloor-heated bathrooms
  • smart TV with full media centre in selected suites
  • luxury Dorp toiletries
  • complimentary wifi
  • full breakfast in the Salon

The Salon

Instead of the usual trappings found in most five-star properties (spa, conference centre, gym), Dorp has a collaborative drawing room that forms the heart of the hotel. Oscar Wilde would have held grand soirées here… You can dine alfresco in the fairytale gardens, and discreetly à deux under a tree, or enjoy a decadent dinner party in the Salon where the piano seems to live amid a jungle of greenery.

The food is unfussy but utterly delicious. There’s a naughty corner for homemade cakes, and the breakfast counter is laden with temptations such as shakshuka, potato tortilla, icing-sugar dusted flapjacks, passionfruit jam, preserves and a round of Queen Vic cheese. In the evenings, sip G&Ts on the roof terrace that overlooks the entirety of Cape Town.

D is for divine

Decency. Originality. Respect. Psycho. Gold stencilled letters on the salon walls give clues to the formula that has been applied in this one-of-a-kind boutique hotel. But the D could just as easily stand for divine. It’s a sublime spot for a romantic weekend or a longer stay. Check in at your own risk; you might never want to leave.

Check out Onderdorp, the brand-new self-catering wing at Dorp.
Good to know Dorp does not have a liquor licence out of respect for the Muslim community of Bo-Kaap, however, you are welcome to bring your own drinks or request the hotel to purchase for you. All mixers are available.
Cost From R2 000 – R10 700 per room per night (depending on season and room type)
Distance from CT 5 minutes
Child friendly? Yes, from 14 years
Pet friendly? Yes, by arrangement
Where to find it 273 Longmarket Street, Schotsche Kloof, Cape Town

title.rendered: Dwyka Tented Lodge at Sanbona: A Romantic Tented Safari Getaway

content.rendered:
Starry skies, gentle dawns and spectacular sunsets against a backdrop of striking rock formations and wild, weathered landscapes… Sanbona Wildlife Reserve is an extraordinary place for a romantic get-away-from-it-all weekend retreat.

The 58 000-hectare reserve, the Cape’s premier Big 5 destination, is home to several accommodation options, but Dwyka is the only adults-only lodge, designed for romance. Nestled in the horseshoe bend of a ravine in the Klein Karoo, it is a small, intimate safari camp where couples can enjoy sheer luxury in the most beautifully weathered landscape.

Romantic getaway

Whether you’re here for your honeymoon, anniversary, or the ultimate romantic retreat, Dwyka has all the privacy and luxury you could dream of in its nine, well-spaced tented suites. Soak in your heated plunge pool under the stars with a bottle of bubbly, dine on your private deck, and let the wilderness work its magic. Under the canopy of your sumptuous suite is everything you need:

  • a king-size bed with crisp white linen
  • minibar
  • tea and coffee station
  • a bathtub for two with a view
  • indoor and outdoor showers
  • a deck with dramatic views of the Lower Bokkeveld cliffs
  • a heated plunge pool
  • outdoor seating and table for private in-room dining

Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served daily in the dining room or in the open-air boma under the stars. There is also an exclusive-use Relaxation Retreat for spa treatments, and the main lodge has a wine cellar and boutique.

Endless exploration

Each day offers the possibility of new adventures: two daily game drives; visiting ancient San rock-art sites; a wilderness walk and picnic; a twilight game drive and sundowners in the bush; a three-course dinner beside the campfire in the boma.

Dwyka Tented Lodge at Sanbona is one of those all-inclusive wilderness experiences where lifetime memories are made.

Good to know When booking for your honeymoon (or anniversary), you’ll receive a complimentary bottle of bubbly, a welcome platter, romantic turn-down, a private bush picnic and an in-room dining experience on one of the evenings of your stay.
Distance from CT 3.5 hours
Cost From R12 980 per night per person sharing
Where to find it Route 62 between Montagu and Barrydale

title.rendered: Beaumont Family Wines Accommodation: Warm Country Hospitality

content.rendered:
It’s easy to feel like part of the family within minutes of arriving at Beaumont. The down-to-earth farm setting, with views over the undulating hills and valleys of the Overberg, is home to three generations of the Beaumont family, who have created an inimitable away-from-it-all ambience that invites you to relax and unwind.

Step back in time

The family has restored three of the original farm cottages, so you can settle in for a weekend of blissful rural peace, serene views, candle-lit evenings and big, star-studded skies. Luxuriously fitted out but still authentic, with a feel of stepping back in time, the cottages are perfectly placed to kick back and relax, swimming in the farm dams, exploring the farm trails on foot or mountain bike, and tasting the farm’s finely crafted wines.

Delicious farm food

The cottages are self-catering but there’s no need to cook, unless you want to. The farm kitchen restaurant is the place for brunch and lunch. The deli shelves are bursting with gorgeous cheeses and charcuterie, home-baked goodies and preserves, and the freezers stock Zest’s tantalising range of delicious home-cooked meals – dinner sorted.

Pepper Tree Cottage

  • 1 bedroom with double bed
  • optional sleeper couch in sitting room for one young adult or two small children
  • 1 bathroom
  • bedding and bath towels provided
  • lounge area with wood-burning stove, electric fans (for summer)
  • fully equipped kitchen, with fireplace, oven, microwave, fridge with small freezer compartment
  • tea, coffee, sugar, mill-flour rusks provided
  • patio with braai facilities, wood, firelighters, candles & matches

Sleeps 2
Cost From R1 750 per night​

The Mill House

  • 1 bedroom with double bed
  • 1 bedroom with twin beds
  • 1 bathroom (shower)
  • extra toilet & basin in second bedroom
  • bedding and bath towels provided
  • option to add two camping mattresses to the living room for children
  • lounge area with wood-burning stove, electric fans (for summer)
  • fully equipped kitchen, with fireplace, oven, microwave, fridge with small freezer compartment
  • tea, coffee, sugar, mill-flour rusks provided
  • patio with braai facilities, wood, firelighters, candles & matches

Sleeps 4
Cost From R2 750 per night​

The Stables

  • 2 bedrooms with king-size bed
  • 1 bedroom with 2 single beds, with the option of 2 additional single beds
  • 2 bathrooms (shower)
  • bedding and bath towels provided
  • lounge area with wood-burning stove, electric fans (for summer)
  • fully equipped kitchen, with oven, microwave, fridge-freezer
  • tea, coffee, sugar, mill-flour rusks provided
  • patio with braai facilities, wood, firelighters, candles & matches

Sleeps 6
Cost R4 000 per night​

While you’re there

With the farm dams, trails and superb meals from the deli, there’s no need to venture further. But there’s plenty more to do in the area if you feel like exploring:

  • horse-riding through the vineyards
  • mini-golf at Benguela
  • Portuguese food at Manny’s
  • animal encounters at Cornellskop
  • wild horses at Bot River lagoon
  • drinks at the historical Bot River hotel bar
  • wine-tasting at neighbouring Bot River wineries
  • drive to Hermanus (30 minutes) for whale-watching (June – November) and seaside pleasures

So pack light and head to Beaumont for a soul-restoring country break with the family.

Good to know The 250-year-old mill is still in working order and you can join the family and Andy Selfe for milling days and buy the organic flour every couple of months.
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 2 – 6
Cost Pepper Tree Cottage From R1 750 per night
The Mill House From R2 750 per night
The Stables From R4 000 per night
Contact 066 251 8155, info@beaumont.co.za
Where to find it Beaumont Wines, Bot River

title.rendered: Angala: A Mountainside Retreat near Franschhoek

content.rendered:
In the foothills of the majestic Simonsberg Mountains, surrounded by verdant gardens and steeped in the kind of countryside tranquillity city folk can only dream of, lies Angala, whose owners Tisha and Pete Cunliffe have created an understated haven where comfort, quiet and a soul-restoring slow time are a given.

Nature is part and parcel of Angala’s holistic approach: outside showers offer majestic views – and the added bonus of a chorus of birdsong in the mornings – while sprawling private gardens open up from enclosed patios, revealing lemon trees and indigenous fynbos, as well as beautiful wooden sculptures.

The lodgings

If luxury linen, a well-stocked minibar, in-room dining facilities and a glorious fireplace are high on your list of requirements, you won’t be disappointed. In the bathroom, floor-to-ceiling glass panes let the light stream in, with an extra-deep tub for lengthy soaks and opulent double showers and basins adding to the luxe appeal. There’s even a decked outdoor shower, reminiscent of top-notch game reserves…

Four Luxury rooms

  • super king-size bed (adjustable into twin beds)
  • en-suite bathroom
  • extra-large open-plan lounge
  • private patio with a secluded garden
  • fireplace
  • outdoor shower
  • daily breakfast
  • complimentary minibar snacks and drinks
  • yoga and Pilates equipment

Cost From R6 710 per person per night sharing

Six Deluxe rooms

  • king-size bed (adjustable into twin beds)
  • en-suite bathroom
  • private patio and garden
  • select rooms have an outdoor shower (enquire when booking)
  • daily breakfast
  • complimentary minibar snacks and drinks
  • yoga and pilates equipment

Cost From R4 895 per person per night sharing

One Luxury Garden Cottage

  • king-size bed (adjustable into twin beds)
  • en-suite bathroom
  • secluded from the rest of the hotel
  • private pool
  • in-room dining facilities
  • large open-plan lounge area
  • daily breakfast
  • complimentary mini-bar snacks and drinks
  • fireplace

Cost From R8 540 per person per night sharing

While you’re there…

It’s a given that you’re here for some serious R+R. Angala’s in-house restaurant serves nourishing breakfast, lunch and dinner daily, catering for any and all dietary requests and needs. In addition to an ozonated pool, there’s a heated plunge pool and a revitalising eco pool, the latter of which has some serious eco cred – it contains absolutely no chemicals, with vegetation keeping it clean and clear. Other facilities include a infra-red sauna and steam rooms.

Experienced therapists can be booked to do a range of treatments in the comfort of your room. And private yoga sessions, too.

Should you decide to leave the property, there is a slew of wine farms, world-class restaurants, incredible hiking and cycling trails, and fabulous shopping in Franschhoek and Stellenbosch, right on your doorstep.

Child friendly? No
Pet friendly? No
Cost Deluxe Rooms: From R4 895 per person per day (depending on season)Luxury Room: From R6 710 per person per night (depending on season)
Garden Cottage: From R8 540 per person per day (depending on season)
Where to find it Corner R45 and Klapmuts Road, Franschhoek

title.rendered: Taaibosch Manor House: Winelands Luxury with a Sense of History

content.rendered:
If you’re looking for an archetypal Stellenbosch Winelands getaway steeped in history, and with all the contemporary creature comforts, the historic Manor House at Taaibosch might just be it.

Bought in 2016 by the Oddos, a French wine-making family, as their South African outpost, the boutique estate has been meticulously converted to organic farming; the superb terroir producing its renowned Crescendo blend. Taaibosch isn’t open to the public, but villa guests are offered an exclusive tour and tasting as part of their stay.

Timeless wine farm luxury

With a thatched roof, green doors and shutters, and ancient oak trees, the 1838 Manor House has been home to generations of families, retaining a sense of timeless peace and gracious living. Sweeping lawns, a long terrace and a private pool courtyard make for easy summer entertaining and leisurely get-togethers with extended family or a group of friends; the vines and mountain views providing a scenic backdrop to life on this working wine farm.

As with Farsight Villa and Garden Villa, this is the deluxe version of self-catering, with a chef preparing breakfast for you each day, a daily service and turndown, and a butler on hand to help as needed. The beautiful kitchen, dining and braai areas make entertaining a breeze, and there’s also the option of hiring a private chef for one or more meals, including a traditional braai or potjie.

The special

From now until 15 December 2022, Taaibosch is offering guests a wonderful three-for-two special.
The details Your stay includes a daily chef-prepared breakfast, service and turndown, and a butler on hand to help as needed.
Cost R38 500 for three nights (sleeps 10)
MAKE A RESERVATION

The lodgings

  • 5 bedrooms: 1 with king bed, 2 with queen beds, 2 with twin/king beds
  • 5 en-suite bathrooms (rain showers)
  • air-conditioning
  • fully equipped kitchen with Nespresso machine
  • lounge with fireplace, smart TV and board games
  • indoor and outdoor dining areas
  • braai area
  • private swimming pool
  • butler
  • chef-prepared breakfast
  • private chef for lunches and dinners (additional cost)
  • fully servicing daily including turndown
  • self-service laundry
  • wifi
  • 24-hour security
  • private wine tasting and tour
  • in-house yoga sessions and spa treatments (additional cost)

Out and about in Stellenbosch

Your butler doubles as a concierge to help plan your days, which can be action-packed or laid back, depending on your mood. Once you’ve hiked the mountain trails leading from the estate, the Stellenbosch Winelands is your oyster… for wine tastings, mountain-biking adventures, trail-running and hiking on the Helderberg mountain trails, restaurants and wine estates, golf, horse-riding and more. Leave time for lazy siestas by the pool, evenings playing board games, and a private tasting of the estate’s famed Crescendo limited-edition wine.

Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? Yes
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 10
Cost October – 15 December 2022: R19 250 per night (minimum 2 nights)
16 December 2022 – 06 January 2023: R23 250 per night (minimum 5 nights)
10 January – 30 April 2023: R19 250 per night (minimum 2 nights)
Where to find it Taaibosch Wine Estate, Cordoba Road, Helderberg, Stellenbosch
MAKE A RESERVATION

title.rendered: Coot Club: A Brand-New Hideaway on the Stanford Lagoon

content.rendered:
If messing about on a lagoon appeals, then Coot Club outside Stanford is your ideal weekend getaway. Three brand-new fresh and light boathouses have been added to the comfortable family accommodation on the Klein River estuary looking out on uninterrupted views across the water to the Maanschynkop mountains.

Easy-breezy living

It’s a conservation wonderland, abundant birdlife flitting among the fynbos and in the 400-year-old milkwood forest that surrounds the stone cottages and historic Spookhuis. The friendly waters of the estuary are ideal for kayaking, SUP boarding, sailing, swimming, and exploring all day long, and the lawns and swimming pools of Coot Club are a natural playground. Only a step away are dunes fringing the Walker Bay Nature Reserve, notable for being a favourite Southern Right whale nursery from July to November.

The lodgings

With wood walls lining tin-roof exteriors, the three new boathouses are perfect for fuss-free holidays spent in and out of the water. Doors open wide onto the views from comfortable living rooms and open-plan kitchens. Self-catering here is a breeze, although breakfasts at the Clubhouse are included and other simple meals can also be booked there.

Starboard

The house is ideally suited to a family, or friends, if you don’t mind a coin toss to see who gets the master suite.

  • 2 bedrooms: 1 main ensuite with lagoon views; 1 twin bedroom with separate bathroom
  • open-plan lounge, dining and kitchen
  • fireplace

Child friendly? Yes
Sleeps 4 adults (and 2 children under 13 years on sofa beds)
Cost From R5 000 per night
MAKE A RESERVATION

Port

  • 3 bedrooms: 2 main ensuite with lagoon views; 1 twin bedroom with separate bathroom
  • open-plan lounge, dining and kitchen
  • fireplace

Child friendly? Yes (snug can accommodate 2 additional children under 13 years, on sofa beds)
Sleeps 6 adults (and 2 children under 13 years on sofa beds)
Cost From R8 000 per night
MAKE A RESERVATION

While you’re there…

Spend all your days in and out of the water, laze on the deck with a book, whalewatch or explore the nearby village of Stanford and the local wine route…

  • guided or solo fynbos + beach walks
  • swimming (lagoon, pool or sea)
  • paddling on the lagoon and river (kayaks supplied)
  • SUPing and sailing (lessons nearby)
  • volleyball and boules
  • board games, table tennis and foosball
  • meals and sundowners at the onsite bar-restaurant
  • fatbiking
  • birdwatching (over 230 species)
  • whale-watching from the dunes (May – November)
  • restaurants, shops, markets and river cruise in Stanford (15 minutes’ drive)
  • local wine route, cheesery and brewery

These beautiful natural surroundings make the perfect backdrop for lifelong family memories of carefree days.

Pet-friendly? No
Child friendly? Yes
Wifi? Yes in public areas

title.rendered: Onderdorp: Unmissable 50% Off Opening Special

content.rendered:
It’s summertime and the jasmine is blooming at Onderdorp, a new homestay wing beneath Cape Town’s fabulously romantic Dorp Hotel. Fifteen beautiful bijoux apartments and rooms clustered around glorious communal indoor and outdoor spaces make up this unique urban oasis at the top of the Bo Kaap, offering resident guests the perks of self-catering accommodation with the ambience of a luxuriously laidback grand hotel.

Onderdorp opening special

From now until 15 December 2022, Onderdorp is running an unmissable 50% off special.
The details The special is valid for stays of two nights or more in a stunning one-bedroom self-catering suite – in return for your feedback on the experience. It does not include any meals.
Valid until 15 December
Cost From R1 600 per room
MAKE A RESERVATION

The lodgings

None of the “kamers” at Onderdorp is exactly alike, but each comes with a perfectly outfitted kitchen or kitchenette. Think Nespresso coffee machines and sparkling pots and pans. The largest verandah suite, Stoep Kamer 3, even boasts two dining room tables. If you don’t feel like cooking, walk up the long white staircase to Dorp’s sublime Salon for a meal – they serve the best buffet breakfast in Cape Town (R249 per person), and extremely delicious lunches and dinners. (Booking is essential as seating is limited.)

  • 15 rooms, sleeping a total of 25 adults
  • 24/7 security
  • 3 plunge pools
  • 2 venues: Games Room and Palm House
  • courtyard with outdoor seating and outdoor fireplace
  • pizza oven and outdoor dining tables
  • dedicated check-in from 8am to 6pm

While you’re there

Sweet dreams are guaranteed at Onderdorp, thanks to the luxury bed linens, a signature of late hotelier Gail Behr’s gorgeously curated interiors. Handmade cotton nightshirts, bespoke scented toiletries, and a bedside bar of chocolate are but a few of the whimsical personal touches waiting in your lodgings.

If you choose to venture forth from your suite (and you’d be forgiven for not wanting to), take a plunge in one of three pools, enjoy uninterrupted views of Table Mountain from wicker armchairs on the verandah, or book Palm House for a special event.

While a stay at Onderdorp is wonderful for two, the gathering spaces are even better shared with friends and family. PS. No visit to Onderdorp would be complete without a trip up the one-storey Wes Anderson-inspired elevator to the shop with the city’s most beautiful view.

Cost Opening special: From R1 600 per room till 15 December 2022
From R 2 500 per adult per night (summer)
From R 2 000 per adult per night (winter)
Pet-friendly? Yes, by prior arrangement
Child-friendly? Yes, from 14 years
Wifi? Yes
Where to find it 18 Ella Street, Bo Kaap, Cape Town
MAKE A RESERVATION

title.rendered: Tilney Manor at Sanbona: A Safari Escape Near Cape Town

content.rendered:
Undulating Klein Karoo landscapes with nothing but nature all the way to the horizon, big skies that sparkle with bright stars at night, spectacular sunsets and luminous dawns, Sanbona is the ultimate wilderness escape. Only three-and-a-half hours from Cape Town, the 58 000-hectare reserve is the Cape’s premier Big 5 destination, but it promises so much more than ticking off wildlife sightings. A weekend away at Sanbona is a soul-restoring experience that soothes, relaxes and resets.

A peaceful haven

Among the four accommodation options, the Georgian-style Tilney Manor stands out for its graceful elegance and historic ambience.

The original homestead dates back to 1894 and was once the home of Swellendam’s district magistrate, with a formal dining room spilling out onto an outdoor dining area and a beamed lounge with a fireplace. Surrounded by an oasis of indigenous gardens, six serene suites are built around the old house, each offering long views over an unspoilt valley of Karoo wilderness, with a wide private verandah where you can soak up the silence.

The lodgings

  • 6 spacious open-plan suites with private verandahs
  • en-suite bathroom with shower, twin basins and freestanding bath in the centre
  • luxurious lounges
  • air conditioning
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • his and hers outdoor showers
  • private mini-bar
  • fireplace

Adventures in nature

Between game nature drives, nature walks, star-gazing and rock-art spotting, it’s easy to fill your days (and nights), but make sure you leave time for relaxing in serene style: beside the rim-flow pool; immersed in the pristine landscape; or with a spa treatment at the relaxation retreat.

Things to do

  • two daily nature drives
  • guided wilderness walks
  • view rock art (there are seven recorded sites at Sanbona)
  • rim-flow pool
  • relaxation retreat with steam room and sauna
  • exercise room

With its stunning location amid the tranquillity of the Klein Karoo wilderness, Tilney Manor provides a restorative all-inclusive getaway.

Good to know Reopens 1 December 2022
Distance from CT 3.5 hours
Pet friendly? No
Child friendly? Yes, 12 years and older
Wifi? Yes
Cost From R7 245 per person, per night (depending on season)
From R13 005 per person, per night (peak season)
Where to find it Route 62 between Montagu and Barrydale
CHECK AVAILABILITY + BOOK DIRECT

title.rendered: Taaibosch Garden Villa: An Intimate Winelands Hideaway

content.rendered:
A boutique villa hideaway tucked among the vineyards and indigenous gardens of Taaibosch Wine Estate, this contemporary garden retreat makes for a wonderfully restoring Winelands escape.

Bought in 2016 by the Oddos, a French wine-making family, as their South African outpost, the boutique estate has been meticulously converted to organic farming; the superb terroir producing its renowned Crescendo blend. Taaibosch isn’t open to the public, but villa guests are offered an exclusive tour and tasting as part of their stay.

Intimate villa luxury

With two bedrooms, Garden Villa is the smallest of the three luxury villas on the estate and looks out onto lawns, indigenous plantings, terraces and vine-clad slopes with the soundtrack of birdsong and the distant sounds of the working wine farm.

As with Farsight Villa and The Manor House, this is the deluxe version of self-catering, with a chef preparing breakfast for you each day, a daily service and turndown, and a butler on hand to help as needed. The beautiful open-plan kitchen, dining and braai areas make entertaining a breeze, and there’s also the option of hiring a private chef for one or more meals, including a traditional braai or potjie.

The special

From now until 15 December 2022, Taaibosch is offering guests a wonderful three-for-two special.

The details Your stay includes a daily chef-prepared breakfast, service and turndown, and a butler on hand to help as needed.
Cost FromR38 500 for three nights (sleeps 5)
MAKE A RESERVATION

The lodgings

  • 2 bedrooms: 1 with king bed, 1 with twin/king bed + 1 rollaway beds for kids
  • 2 en-suite bathrooms (free-standing bathtubs and rain showers)
  • fully equipped kitchen with Nespresso machine
  • lounge with fireplace, smart TV and board games
  • indoor and outdoor dining areas
  • braai area
  • private swimming pool
  • butler
  • chef-prepared breakfast
  • private chef for lunches and dinners (additional cost)
  • fully servicing daily including turndown
  • self-service laundry
  • wifi
  • 24-hour security
  • private wine tasting and tour
  • in-house yoga sessions and spa treatments (additional cost)

Out and about in Stellenbosch

Your butler doubles as a concierge to help plan your days, which can be action-packed or laid back, depending on your mood. Once you’ve hiked the mountain trails leading from the estate, the Stellenbosch Winelands is your oyster… for wine tastings, mountain-biking adventures, trail-running and hiking on the Helderberg mountain trails, restaurants and wine estates, golf, horse-riding and more. Leave time for lazy siestas by the pool, evenings playing board games, and a private tasting of the estate’s famed Crescendo limited-edition wine.

Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? Yes
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 5 (4 adults + 1 child)
Cost October – 15 December 2022: From R19 250 per night
16 December 2022 – 06 January 2023: From R23 250 per night
7 January – 30 April 2023: From R20 500 per night
1 May – 30 September 2023: From R16 500 per night
Where to find it Taaibosch Wine Estate, Cordoba Road, Helderberg, Stellenbosch
MAKE A RESERVATION

title.rendered: Hazendal Homestead Summer Accommodation Offers

content.rendered:
The rolling meadows of the Stellenbosch Winelands form the backdrop to this elegant Cape Dutch homestead, whose current owners renovated and restored it to serve as a luxurious getaway. The historical architecture evokes a bygone era and offers a grand and gracious setting from which to enjoy the tranquillity of the Winelands, as well as the numerous attractions on offer at Hazendal Wine Estate.

And this summer season, Hazendal is welcoming guests with a series of great accommodation deals.

Milestone celebratory offer

The details Receive a 20% discount on exclusive-use stays of two days (or more). The villa sleeps up to 10 adults and two children and includes breakfast, a two-course family dinner for 10 guests, a four-course food-and-wine pairing dinner including a bottle of cap classique and canapes, a celebratory cake, curated art tours at the Marvol Gallery, wine tasting in the elegant Wine Lounge and free entry to Wonderdal, a magical edutainment centre for children between 5 and 13 years.
Cost From R33 150 per night (sleeps 10 adults + 2 children)
Valid until 31 October 2022
MAKE A RESERVATION

Summer holiday offers

The details Stay for three nights; pay for two. Your stay includes breakfast for 10 guests, curated art tours in the Marvol Gallery, wine tasting in the elegant Wine Lounge, access to the world-class, par-3 golf course and free entry to Wonderdal, a magical edutainment centre for children between 5 and 13 years.
Cost From R37 500 per night (sleeps 10 adults + 2 children)
Valid 1 October – 15 December 2022
From 16 December, you’ll receive a discounted rate per night when you book for two nights (minimum).
Cost From R54 000 per night
Valid 16 December – 28 February 2023
MAKE A RESERVATION

Linger-for-longer offer

The details Stay for four nights; pay for three. Your stay includes return airport transfers from Cape Town International Airport, breakfast for 10 guests, one three-course dinner, curated art tours in the Marvol Gallery, wine tasting in the elegant Wine Lounge, access to the world-class, par-3 golf course and free entry to Wonderdal, a magical edutainment centre for children between 5 and 13 years.
Valid 16 December – 28 February 2023
Cost From R54 000 per night (sleeps 10 adults + 2 children)
MAKE A RESERVATION

The lodgings

The exclusive-use homestead sleeps 12 guests (sleeps 10 adults + 2 children) in five bedrooms and has a dining hall, a library, a bridal lounge, a kitchen, two private balconies and a terrace overlooking the lush garden.

  • 5 bedrooms (The Voloshin, The Bosman, The Van As, The Hazenwinkel and The Vermaak Room)
  • king-size or queen-size beds
  • en-suite bathrooms with a bath and/or shower
  • bathrobes
  • stocked pantry
  • bar
  • air conditioning
  • complimentary wifi
  • daily breakfast

Add exquisite interior decor and artwork, the services of a 24-hour dedicated butler and concierge desk, and you have all you need for a sumptuous taste of Cape Winelands life.

CHECK AVAILABILITY + BOOK DIRECT

While you’re there…

Situated in the heritage-rich and beautiful Cape Winelands, Hazendal offers a string of pleasurable pursuits: Babushka Deli (that also offers picnics), Pivnushka Beer Garden, Hazendal Tea experience, the elegant Wine Tasting Lounge and tours of the estate’s Marvol Art Gallery. Children will also be fully entertained and taken care of at Wonderdal, a magical edutainment centre for children between 5 and 13 years. The world-class, par-3 golf course, driving range with tracking technology and family-friendly putting park with different skill levels is also at guests’ disposal.

Distance from CT 30 minutes
Child friendly Yes
Pet friendly No
Where to find it Hazendal Wine Estate, Bottelary Road, Stellenbosch

title.rendered: Gondwana at Sanbona: A Family Safari Escape near Cape Town

content.rendered:
At 58 000 hectares, it’s hard to fathom that this rugged and peaceful reserve in the Klein Karoo is almost the same size as Singapore! Tucked into the majestic Warmwaterberg Mountains and surrounded by ancient rock formations, once home to the Khoisan people, Sanbona offers the type of seclusion that makes the rest of the world seem irrelevant.

The malaria-free reserve offers a choice of three lodges; Gondwana is best-suited for a stylish family getaway.

The lodgings

The lodge’s 12 suites have a distinct African-safari aesthetic, and each has its own private balcony boasting unhindered views of the endless plains. (Interleading rooms and sleeper couches for larger families can be arranged.) There are no room keys (though you can latch your door for privacy when you’re inside), which speaks to the safety and remoteness of the setting.

  • 12 suites with a king-size bed and sleeper couch (interleading suites available too)
  • private deck overlooking the Anysberg Mountains and Bellair Dam
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower, free-standing bath, and twin basins
  • fully stocked mini-bar
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • electronic safe
  • complimentary wifi
  • international dial telephone
  • shared lounge and dining area in the main building
  • reserve-facing pool and shaded terrace
  • communal boma and outdoor braai
  • relaxation retreat with a steam room

Good to know All meals, nonalcholic beverages, on-drive snacks and drinks, nature walks and two daily nature drives are included.

Kids on Safari at Gondwana

This exciting programme of educational and recreational wildlife experiences is designed to stimulate and inspire tomorrow’s eco-warriors. The evening scorpion hunt and storytelling around the fire with braaied marshmallows are undeniable highlights, and there’s also a skull garden trail that takes them through the gardens to learn about the lifecycle of various plants and animals on the reserve.

On arrival, kiddies receive a Welcome Pack that includes a Sanbona Activity Book filled with interactive activities (such as collecting dung!). The supervised playroom is stocked with toys, games, DVDs and books – and is conveniently close to the spa – so grown-ups can languish or enjoy a game drive while kiddies play (since children under 4 years are not permitted on drives).

While you’re there

The two daily nature drives are the main event – and, naturally, what most visitors are here for. Our guide Thomas was a font of information (did you know that buffalos are the priciest beasts; one recently fetched R163 million!) and patience!

With its sacred setting, wonderful facilities and proximity to Cape Town, it’s no wonder Sanbona is considered the Cape’s premier wildlife destination. And, of course, the dazzling array of wildlife, featuring the legendary Big Five.

Distance from Cape Town 3.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes, free
Cost From R9 720 per person (adults)
From R4 860 (children 4 – 11 years)
Free children 0 – 3 years
Valid until 30 November 2022
Where to find it Route 62, between Montagu and Barrydale
CHECK AVAILABILITY + BOOK DIRECT

title.rendered: Slipway Cottage: A Private Haven On the Shores of Langebaan Lagoon

content.rendered:
Hidden deep within the West Coast National Park, the fishing hamlet of Churchhaven is a remote, truly off-the-beaten track enclave. With only a handful of cottages available to rent, and no shops or other facilities to speak of, it’s a sought-after escape for city folk who want to get back to nature.

With its whitewashed walls and sea-green shutters, Slipway Cottage blends perfectly into its surroundings on the sandy western shore of Langebaan Lagoon. From your spot on the sunny verandah, you’ll be mesmerised by the sparkling, translucent waters and big blue horizon. This solar-powered cottage may be remote but it’s equipped with all the creature comforts and designer details – the perfect space for a group getaway that requires only good food, gentle activity and all the time in the world to dream.

The lodgings

  • four bedrooms (1 king bed and 3 queens)
  • all queen bedrooms have a loft with single bed; two of the queen bedrooms are joined by a sliding door)
  • three en-suite bathrooms and two outdoor showers
  • fully equipped kitchen with gas stove and dishwasher
  • open-plan lounge and dining area with fireplace
  • furnished verandah with firepit, braai and pizza oven
  • sheltered courtyard with dining table
  • satellite TV

Things to do

  • swimming in the lagoon
  • stand-up paddling (boards supplied)
  • beach walks and picnics
  • two day-hiking trails in the park
  • four mountain-biking trails in the park
  • birdwatching and wildlife viewing
  • Kraalbaai and Preekstoel Beach nearby (36km)
  • whale-watching and wildflowers (in season)
  • restaurants, shops and activities in Langebaan (52km away)

Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 11
Cost From R8 500 per night (minimum two-night stay)(depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

title.rendered: Melozhori Treehouse: A Luxe Off-Grid Wilderness Escape

content.rendered:
The herds of springbok and giraffe casually strolling through the otherwise uninhabited landscapes at Melozhori Game Reserve make you feel like you’re a million miles away from civilisation, not to mention the deep silence, clean air and wide vistas of rolling hills and the Overberg mountains…

This 2 300-hectare spread of wilderness is actually less than 200km up the N2 from Cape Town, near Bonnievale, ideal for a weekend getaway where you can soak up the romance of the wilderness under a sparkling canopy of stars at night.

A brand-new treehouse for two, launched at the beginning of September 2022, adds another level of low-key luxury to the exclusive accommodation choices on the private game reserve. Perched on the slopes of an unspoilt valley in folds of hills, it feels as if you’re alone in the wilderness, apart from the resident wildlife, birds and geckos.

Earth-friendly luxury

Built around a tree spanning two levels, with glass walls immersing you in the natural landscape, the treehouse is a magical kind of place you could happily hole up in for weeks. Totally off-grid with solar-power running everything, it has an aura of earth-friendly luxury and is designed for easy self-catering and total privacy. Picture yourselves soaking in the wood-fired hot tub on the deck at sunset, a glass of bubbly at hand, while the fire burns down to embers in the pizza oven, for a simple but delicious supper. The solar system even runs to air-conditioning for those hot summer days (but only during daylight hours while the solar panels are active).

  • one bedroom, sleeping two adults
  • en-suite bathroom with a bath
  • shower on deck
  • open-plan kitchen with an oven, microwave, stove, fridge-freezer
  • open-plan lounge and dining area with an indoor fireplace
  • two outdoor decks with a braai, firepit and seating area
  • wood-fired hot tub
  • 3m hammock
  • wood-fired pizza oven
  • air conditioning
  • complimentary wifi
  • Bluetooth sound system

Explore the reserve

A guided game drive is included in each two-night stay booked, offering an opportunity to explore the lay of the land and observe the wildlife, which includes 36 species of game and 131 identified bird species in wide open landscapes that include a unique mix of renosterveld, succulent Karoo and fynbos. Then you’re free to walk, run or cycle for miles on the network of trails in the reserve, without meeting a soul besides zebra and bontebok – there are no big-cat predators here so you and the zebra are safe.

Sundowners in the bush

If the decision-making and shopping aspect of self-catering doesn’t appeal, Melozhori’s semi-catered package is the perfect solution. They supply all the ingredients for pizza-making one night and a braai the next, plus continental breakfasts, cheese platters and snacks. Their meat is all halaal and includes venison from the reserve, sausages or salami, and home-made beef macon.

Or book a game drive and sundowners for that extra splash of romance (bring your own bubbly should you want something stronger than the delicious but alcohol-free Melozhori sparkling grape juice).

So if romantic seclusion in the wild sounds like your ideal couples getaway, be one of the first to experience the magic of Melozhori Treehouse from mid-September 2022.

Distance from CT 2.5 hours
Child friendly? No
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 2
Cost From R7 500 per unit per night (2 nights minimum stay off-peak; 3 nights minimum stay during peak periods)
Cost From R750 semi-catered option per adult per night
Where to find it Melozhori Game Reserve, Overberg, 5km from the N2 turn-off to Stormsvlei

title.rendered: Farm 215: Hot Tub Accommodation in an Eco-Nature Retreat

content.rendered:
It’s easy to get lost in nature at Farm 215. The 800-hectare private nature reserve between Stanford and Cape Agulhas is a conservation-first retreat, recently upgraded for self-catering in absolute eco-friendly comfort.

The three newly refurbished Fynbos Suites come with fully equipped kitchens, wood-fired hot tubs that double as summer splash pools, and wide-open views across this private paradise.

With the imminent addition of two more exclusive accommodation offerings, Farm 215 hosts no more than 20 guests at a time.

Its owners are passionate about conservation, having invested 16 years in clearing invasive vegetation, planting an indigenous forest and restoring the ex-farmland to fynbos floral beauty, and in the process attracting a plethora of wildlife.

Escape the world, unwind and drink in the big skies and pristine landscapes.

Three Fynbos Suites

The newly revamped Fynbos Suites are designed for seclusion, set 65 metres apart amid unspoilt fynbos, with floor-to-ceiling windows that maximise the uninterrupted views and allow you to lose yourself in the spectacular surroundings. Loadshedding-proof, the kitchens use gas stoves and ovens, the water is heated by gas, while solar panels provide electricity for the rest.

  • Three Fynbos Suites, each sleeps 2 adults (plus 1 child under 12 if requested)
  • floor-to-ceiling and wall-to-wall glass sliding doors
  • covered wooden deck with a seating area and braai
  • private wood-fired hot tub (summer splash pool)
  • king-size bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and bath
  • wood-burning fireplace
  • open-plan lounge
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • ceiling fan
  • fynbos toiletries
  • complimentary wifi

Cost From R2 250 per night (depending on season; minimum two-night stay)
Distance from CT 2.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
BOOK DIRECT

Mountain Suite

This apartment has rolling views over the fynbos hills to the back of the reserve, its own private courtyard, garden and covered lapa with a braai area, and plunge pool/wood-fired hot tub.

  • sleeps 5 adults
  • 1 queen-size master bedroom-come-lounge
  • 1 bedroom with 3 single beds
  • optional addition of Garden Suite apartment (sleeps 2)
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • shared bathroom + second outdoor shower
  • covered braai area
  • private garden and courtyard
  • private hot tub
  • complimentary wifi

Cost From R2 200 per night (depending on season; minimum two-night stay)
Distance from CT 2.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
BOOK DIRECT

Out and about in nature


Teagan Cunniffe

With over 30 kilometres of hiking, mountain-biking and horseback-riding trails on the reserve, it’s easy to get out and about in nature. Scintillating hikes through the farm trails reveal soaring black eagles and darting sugarbirds, rock hyrax and antelope, the tracks of leopard, bar-eared fox and cape clawless otter, and perhaps the resident baboon troop, who hang out at the foot of the waterfall at night.

Meander through the young indigenous forest and even plant a tree as your contribution to the reforestation project. Or go for restful serenity: kick back and relax by the 25-metre-long swimming pool filled with golden mountain water.

Visit neighbouring wine farms, such as Black Oystercatcher and Lomond Wine Estatefor day trips, tasting sessions, or bite to eat. Or, head to the ocean for whale-watching in nearby Walker Bay, long beach walks and swims, or eco-marine boat trips.

Good to know Fynbos Hill, the old homestead, is currently undergoing restoration and will be available for bookings from December 2022. The four-bedroom house sleeps up to eight adults and two children, with a private garden and courtyard, and an adjacent building serving as the communal lounge, dining and kitchen.
Cost From R5 000 per night (depending on season; minimum two-night stay)

Distance from CT 2.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No

Mountain Suite: From R2 300 per night
Fynbos Hill: From R5 000 per night

title.rendered: The Hacienda at Fazenda: A Mountain Villa with Designer Cred

content.rendered:
The charming, historic town of Swellendam is a popular stopover on the road to the Garden Route, but it’s also become a sought-after destination in its own right for a country escape.

Just out of town, hidden in the Hermitage Valley at the foot of the Langeberg Mountains, you’ll find that sweet spot – Fazenda Luxury Retreat & Farm – a place of breathtaking natural beauty and sumptuous guest accommodation. Already known for its characterful stone cottages and greenhouse, The Hacienda is Fazenda’s latest offering.

A country villa in a secret valley

Conjuring all the romance of a Spanish estate, this designer dwelling is a beauty. White walls and ceilings, polished cement floors and large windows create the perfect canvas for exquisitely curated furnishings and artworks.

It’s all about laidback luxury… While away days under the shadowy slatted roof on the patio, enjoying good food, wine and conversation, or soaking up the magnificent scenery and sunshine on a lounger next to the pool. Light a crackling fire at night and count the stars…

The lodgings

  • two en-suite bedrooms (one detached from the main villa), with fireplaces
  • four-poster beds with Egyptian-cotton linen
  • bathrooms with a walk-in shower and Africology products
  • fully equipped kitchen (with Smeg coffee maker and convection microwave)
  • spacious lounge and dining area with wood-burning fireplace
  • patio with sunloungers
  • swimming pool
  • braai and firepit

While you’re there…

You’re free to explore this working farm, which has sections of lush forest, a dam and plenty of walking and hiking trails, including fynbos-lined paths up into the mountains to seek out rock pools. The birdlife is wonderful, with over 200 species spotted, and there’s a good chance you’ll see some wildlife too.

  • visit the adjacent Marloth Nature Reserve
  • berry-picking (in season)
  • canoeing on the Buffeljags Dam nearby
  • guided horse trails nearby
  • restaurants, cafes, shops and more in Swellendam (7 mins away)

Distance from Cape Town 2.5 hours
Child-friendly? Yes, 12 years and older
Pet-friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 4
Cost From R4 400 per night (depending on season)
Where to find it Fazenda Farm, Hermitage Valley Road, Swellendam

title.rendered: Jonkmanshof: A Stylish Farmhouse Stay in Montagu

content.rendered:
Montagu is a charming town in the Little Karoo whose quaint shops and restaurants, breathtaking mountain views and heritage architecture might leave you wanting to linger longer. Fortunately, we know just the spot.

Dating back to 1854, Jonkmanshof has had many incarnations during its almost-200-year life, including being the headquarters of the local newspaper, the town’s first restaurant, an art gallery, a hair salon and now – after a stylish and savvy facelift – two beautiful country homes. They’re co-owned by Jacques Erasmus of Hemelhuijs restaurant in Cape Town, so you can expect an utterly gorgeous evocation of Cape country life – and wonderful food.

The lodgings

Located in a quiet side street just off the main road, both homes offer spellbinding views of mountains, orchards and gardens. Inside, the owners have given the houses a fresh lease on life, while preserving key features, such as original wooden floorboards and high ceilings, and adding some warm country-style touches, such as exposed river-reed ceilings and a selection of the finest antiques and furniture.

A Jonkmanshof Experience

Also known as “The House Where Lemons Grow”, Jonkmanshof is home to the most charming citrus garden whose ornamental pots of lemon, orange and naartjie trees produce fruit that’s used to create bespoke products, from citrus sea salt flakes and organic limoncello to marmalade and even fruit-shaped soaps.


@karen_s_camera

20 Bath Street

  • Suite One with a king-size bed (can be made into twins) and en-suite bathroom with a shower and bateau bath
  • Suite Two with a queen-size bed (can be made into twins) and en-suite bathroom with a bath and hand showerer
  • wood-burning fireplace in the lounge
  • library and desk
  • fully equipped kitchen, with a wood-burning stove for winter)
  • private garden with a farm-style swimming pool
  • outside terrace with recliners and a dining table
  • indigenous succulent greenhouse
  • complimentary wifi

30 Bath Street

  • Suite One with a queen-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • Suite Two with a queen-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • each suite has an en-suite bathroom with a shower and bateau bath
  • wood-burning fireplace in the lounge
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • private garden with a farm-style swimming pool
  • outside terrace with recliners and a dining table
  • complimentary wifi

And, true to its pastoral setting, this is a white-noise-free space, which means there is no TV! All the better to immerse yourself in the majesty and tranquillity of the setting. Whether you rent out these homes exclusively, or on a per-room basis, Jonkmanshof is the perfect sanctuary for a quiet escape.
CHECK AVAILABLILTY + BOOK DIRECT

While you’re there…

Whether you choose to spend the day in the garden, lounging by the pools in summer, curling up with a book in front of the fire when it’s chilly, hiking in the mountains, rock-climbing, playing a round of golf, taking a drive in a classic car, or enjoying a coffee from a local café, you’ll find more than enough to keep you occupied – and utterly relaxed – at this Karoo idyll.

Distance from CT 2.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No

title.rendered: Farsight Villa at Taaibosch: Contemporary Luxury in the Stellenbosch Winelands

content.rendered:
Perched high on the Helderberg slopes, this impeccable contemporary villa in the Stellenbosch Winelands lives up to its name, with panoramic bird’s-eye views to Table Mountain and False Bay over the mountain vineyards of Taaibosch Wine Estate.

Bought in 2016 by the Oddos, a French wine-making family, as their South African outpost, the boutique estate has been meticulously converted to organic farming; the superb terroir producing its renowned Crescendo blend. Taaibosch isn’t open to the public, but villa guests are offered an exclusive tour and tasting as part of their stay.

Effortless villa luxury

At the very top of the estate, the newly launched Farsight Villa is completely private. Lying back on a lounger beside the pool, you’ll feel like you’re on top of the world: watching raptors circling on the high air currents to the sounds of birdsong among the fynbos. This is the deluxe version of self-catering, with a chef preparing breakfast for you, a daily service and turndown, and a butler on hand to help as needed. The beautiful kitchen, pizza oven and braai area make entertaining a breeze, and there’s also the option of hiring a private chef for one or more meals including a traditional braai or potjie.

The lodgings

  • 4 bedrooms: 2 with king beds, 2 with twin/king beds + 2 rollaway beds for kids
  • 4 en-suite bathrooms (one with bathtub and shower, three with rain showers)
  • fully equipped kitchen with Nespresso machine
  • lounge with fireplace and board games
  • TV room with smart TV + Netflix
  • indoor and outdoor dining areas
  • braai area and pizza oven
  • private swimming pool
  • butler
  • chef-prepared breakfast
  • private chef for lunches and dinners (additional cost)
  • fully servicing daily including turndown
  • self-service laundry
  • wifi
  • 24-hour security
  • private wine tasting and tour
  • in-house yoga sessions and spa treatments (additional cost)

Out and about in Stellenbosch

Your butler doubles as a concierge to help plan your days, which can be action-packed or laid back, depending on your mood. Once you’ve hiked the mountain trails leading from the estate, the Stellenbosch Winelands is your oyster… for wine tastings, mountain-biking adventures, trail-running and hiking on the Helderberg mountain trails, restaurants and wine estates, golf, horse-riding and more. Leave time for lazy siestas by the pool, evenings playing board games, and the best-possible vantage point for sundowners with a glass of the superb estate wine.

Good to know Special until 15 December 2022: pay for two nights; stay for three.
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 8 adults + 2 children under 12
Cost May – September 2022: From R28 500 per night
October – 15 December 2022: From R35 250 per night
16 December 2022 – 06 January 2023: From R42 500 per night
Where to find it Taaibosch Wine Estate, Cordoba Road, Helderberg, Stellenbosch

title.rendered: Dar-El-Qamar: Designed for Serenity and Relaxed Weekend Bliss

content.rendered:
It’s calm but curated, a series of tranquil, beautifully designed rooms and outdoor spaces set up for sublime weekend getaways. Dar-el-Qamar translates as Monastery of the Moon, inspired by this Tulbagh heritage building’s previous incarnation as a place of spiritual learning and mission school in the 1800s. In the late 20th century it was home to renowned South African artist Christo Coetzee, whose art takes its rightful place in beautiful interiors.

Rooms to explore

A weekend starts with a warm welcome from housekeeper Boston Munthali, the fridge in the stone-flagged kitchen stocked with crisp vegetables from the Tulbagh community garden. An exploratory wander through the enticing spaces, fragrant with herbs and flowers, reveals an inspiring sanctuary with a world of possibilities. The former artist’s studio is now a serene yoga studio often used for retreats with adjoining treatment room, a sunny deck holds a plunge pool and sauna, a shaded courtyard the braai area, the 70s-style pool room is funky with vintage finds, and the lounge has a turntable for chilling out to the vinyl collection.

The lodgings

  • 3 bedrooms (one is a loft room) with king or queen beds
  • 3 en-suite bathrooms (one with bathtub and shower, two with showers)
  • fully equipped kitchen plus extra kitchenette
  • lounge with fireplace, books and vinyl record player
  • dining room plus outdoor dining area
  • two courtyards
  • braai area and firepit
  • deck with plunge pool
  • sauna and yoga room
  • treatment room for massages
  • house manager to help guests with anything they need

Village living

The house is perfectly placed on historic Church Street, a quiet tree and garden-lined road full of Cape Dutch, Victorian and Edwardian gems, so it’s easy to stroll out and explore the village on foot.

Things to do

  • in-house spa treatments
  • explore Tulbagh’s museums and historic buildings
  • restaurants, coffee shops and shops nearby
  • Tulbagh wine valley
  • hiking trails
  • horse-riding

Set your tempo to slow with a Dar-el-Qamar mini-break that recharges body and soul.

Distance from Cape Town 1.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes, from 6 years
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Sleeps 6
Cost October 2022 – 30 November 2022: From R4 800 per night
1 December 2022 – February 2023: From R5 500 per night
Where to find it 26 Church Street, Tulbagh

title.rendered: Languedoc Cabin: An Idyllic Self-Catering Escape in Blaauwklippen Valley

content.rendered:
At the foothills of the Stellenbosch Mountains in the Blaauwklippen Valley, Languedoc Farm is flanked by lush farmlands, with horses grazing in green meadows. Here, visitors can look forward to a delightful country stay, where a garden filled with 70-year-old liquid amber trees creates a sense of enchantment. A garden path leads down to the Blaauwklippen River, a lovely spot to relax and enjoy the scenic sights and sounds of the rich birdlife.

There are three accommodation offerings on the farm, but it’s the secluded one-bedroom wooden cabin (opened in December 2021 in honour of owner Diana Perry’s late husband) that offers a true reprieve from city life. With its luxury furnishings, the en-suite cottage boasts an open-plan living area with a closed-combustion fireplace that quickly cosies up the entire space.

Outside, a large covered verandah overlooks a fire pit and rock pond with a dreamy outlook of the paddock and horses in the background. These beautiful natural surroundings provide the perfect space to breathe out and unwind.

The lodgings

  • one-bedroom cabin with extra-length queen bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower
  • fully equipped kitchen with gas hob
  • open-plan living area with indoor fireplace
  • smart TV for streaming
  • outdoor firepit/braai
  • large verandah with seating and dining table

Things to do

  • walks in the gardens and beside the river
  • hiking trails in nearby forest and up the Helderberg
  • stargazing
  • wine farms nearby
  • mountain-biking nearby
  • Stellenbosch restaurants and shops 10 minutes’ drive away

While you’re there

The charming town of Stellenbosch is a mere 10-minute drive away) – not only is it a cultural and historic centre, it’s also renowned for its many eateries and popular bars.

For those craving a little more action, the area has various walking, running and mountain-biking trails, especially around Stellenbosch Mountains. A peaceful walk on the beach or exhilarating dip in the ocean at Strand is a 20-minute drive away.

If golf is your game, the Stellenbosch Golf Club is conveniently situated at the end of Blaauwklippen Road, with the Erinvale or Pearl Valley golf courses a little further away.

Guests also have many marvellous wine-tasting options (this is the famed Winelands after all!), with Dornier, Waterford, Keermont and de Trafford nearby. Also, do book a tour of Dylan Lewis’ Sculpture Garden – it’s an awe-inspiring experience!

Distance from CT 60 minutes
Child friendly? Yes, from 12 years
Pet friendly? No
Wifi Yes, free
Sleeps 2
Cost From R1 600 per night (depending on season; minimum two-night stay)
Where to find it Languedoc Farm, Blaauwklippen Road, Stellenbosch, Western Cape

title.rendered: Lanzerac Hotel & Spa: Five-Star Luxury For Less in Stellenbosch

content.rendered:
After a fire severely damaged this three-century-old hotel in May 2017, this spectacular wine farm has emerged more beautiful than ever, with beautifully refurbished rooms, a spa that knocks the socks off even the most well-heeled resorts in Europe, three dining venues with their own distinctive characters, a tasting room, and some of the most breathtaking views in the land.

Lush gardens and rolling vineyards surround the estate, with the picturesque Jonkershoek mountains forming a dramatic backdrop and evoking an inescapable sense of tranquillity. And yet, its close proximity to Stellenbosch central means guests have the best of both worlds.

The lodgings

There are 53 stylish rooms and suites, each individually decorated, with all the modern facilities and creature comforts needed to make your stay memorable. A delectable breakfast is served daily in the Manor Kitchen.

  • 23 Classic Rooms; 18 Luxury Rooms; 5 Junior Suites; 7 Suites
  • Luxury Rooms + Junior Suites have a desk, lounge area and private outdoor terrace
  • Suites have a lounge with fireplace and a private outdoor terrace with a pool
  • king-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • en-suite bathroom with a bath and shower
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities (including a Nespresso machine)
  • luxury toiletries
  • satellite TV
  • air-conditioning and underfloor heating
  • complimentary minibar
  • laundry service
  • daily transfers to Stellenbosch
  • complimentary wi-fi
  • nightly turndown service

Dining at Lanzerac

Lanzerac is home to the immaculate Manor Kitchen, one of three restaurants on the estate, and certainly the most dazzling, with its eye-catching chandeliers, oversized leaded windows and lofty proportions. Each morning, the restaurant is a hive of activity when the bountiful breakfast buffet opens for service, after which beautifully crafted classical dishes are available to order for dinner or Sunday lunch.

For a more casual experience, the Lanzerac Deli serves all-day breakfasts, homemade breads, pastries, sandwiches, local cheeses and charcuterie platters. And, should you be in the mood for a more festive atmosphere, there’s Taphuis: a bar that is beautifully decorated in an array of vintage pieces, serving gourmet pub grub beside a roaring fireplace in winter, or outdoors on the terrace in summer.

There’s also the moody Craven Lounge, which offers gourmet small plates and boasts an extensive selection of the finest local and international spirits, a curated wine list, and an impressive cigar menu.

Relax and unwind

The spa at Lanzerac offers some of the best vistas (and facilities) in the business. The overarching attention to detail – from the exquisite design and location to the service and offerings – will leave you feeling contained, cosseted and utterly content.

There are eight state-of-the-art treatment rooms, including a NeoQi Mediq Cocoon, mist room and an experience shower. Spa guests are invited to make use of the heated pool, bubbling jacuzzi, sauna and steam room, while the fitness room is reserved for hotel guests only. There’s even a Vitality Corner for wholesome post-treatment juices, salads and smoothies.

Experience and explore

Lanzerac sits in the foothills of the Jonkershoek Valley, granting easy access to the Jonkershoek Nature Reserve and the smaller Assegaaibosch Nature Reserve. Guests can immerse themselves in the beauty of the region with guided walks and bike rides in the reserve, or explore the history of Stellenbosch with a guided walking tour that focuses on the culture and architecture of the town. Also included in your stay is a complimentary wine-tasting in The Lanzerac Tasting Room and a tour of the winery and where the world’s first pinotage was produced and bottled.

With all this and more, it’s no wonder Lanzerac is considered a dream destination for locals and out-of-towners alike.

Distance from CT 45 minutes
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it Lanzerac Wine Estate, 1 Lanzerac Road, Stellenbosch, Western Cape

title.rendered: Leopard Valley Eco Retreat: Off-Grid Cabins in the Cederberg

content.rendered:
Hidden in a valley halfway between Citrusdal and Clanwilliam in the majestic Cederberg, this eco retreat on a 1 200-hectare farm offers a soul-firing escape in tranquil natural beauty. Shipping containers have been cleverly and stylishly converted into four cabins, painted black and positioned beneath a well-ventilated roof structure, with sliding doors that open onto a deck yielding spectacular views.

The lodgings

Of the four cabins, Verreaux’s Eagle, named after the bird of prey that soars above the wild farm, is the most romantic. Aside from the privately located spring-fed reservoir (ideal in winter if you’re an advocate for Wim Hof cold-water immersion therapy), there is an alfresco bathtub with piping hot water – magic for stargazing. Floor-to-ceiling windows make the most of the marvellous views by day. As for the other cabins, Malachite Sunbird has a wood-burning hot tub sunk into the deck, while Cape Sugarbird overlooks a spring-fed dam with waterlilies and unobstructed views across reflective waters to the distant smudge of mountains.

  • 4 off-grid cabins: Verreaux’s Eagle (sleeps 2), Malachite Sunbird (sleeps 2), Cape Sugarbird (sleeps 4), Cape Canary (sleeps 2)
  • bathroom with indoor and outdoor shower (outdoor bathtub in Verreaux’s Eagle)
  • eco-friendly bathroom amenities
  • fully equipped kitchenette with gas hob and fridge
  • living room with gas fireplace (except Malachite Sunbird)
  • deck with outdoor seating (and hot tub in Malachite Sunbird)
  • braai and firepit
  • wood-fired hot tub

While you’re there

The pristine surroundings offer a natural playground of gentle, pleasurable pursuits – from exploring the farm to birdwatching and animal-spotting (particularly fun at night, when nocturnal creatures such as porcupines and aardvarks are out and about). There’s hiking in the mountains and amid rock formations, where you might discover San rock paintings, a springtime carpet of wildflowers to wander in, and swimming in spring-fed dams. In the late afternoon, simply relax beside a log fire and stargaze.

Distance from CT 2.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? Yes
Wifi? Yes
Cost From R1 490 per cabin per night (minimum two nights)
Where to find it Markuskraal Road, off N7, Clanwilliam/Citrusdal

title.rendered: Nima Lodge: Luxury Cabins above the Wilderness Treetops

content.rendered:
The Garden Route, famed for ancient forests, gushing rivers, vibrant wetlands, beaches, fynbos and mountains, is lined with a string of coastal resorts, one of which is Wilderness. Here, all these natural landmarks converge to form a landscape of restorative beauty – a perfect location for the beautiful Nima Lodge.

Overlooking wooded hills and valleys to the distant Outeniqua Mountains beyond, the lodge comprises seven spacious cabins, all self-catering, with individually decorated open-plan interiors, complete with oversized bathtubs and private decks. The style is contemporary luxury, with an emphasis on warmth and comfort and an overarching attention to detail.

The sun-drenched pool deck hints at Nima’s name – “sun” in Tibetan – and it’s a short stroll away from the Touw River hiking trails and waterfalls in Wilderness National Park.

Brand-new Sand Cabins

With their curved walls, trapezoid shape and unique silhouette, the sand dune-inspired Sand Cabins are quite extraordinary – an architect-designed departure from Nima Lodge’s more traditional wood cabins. It’s a multi-level “space to dream in”, from the raised bed to the couch in front of the fireplace and out onto the deck with its hot tub. The bathroom is in a separate “tower” structure, with the bath positioned in front of a large picture-window.

Cost From R3 600 per night (depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

Sun Cabins

The three original lodgings are traditional timber cabins, with a large deck and a daybed overlooking the indigenous forest. Recent renovations have added a second deck down a spiral staircase, complete with outdoor shower, hot tub and a firepit braai area.
Cost From R2 500 per night (depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

Luna Cabin


Isabel Hayn

One of the original cabins has been renovated and expanded into a more expansive, luxurious dwelling with high-beamed ceilings, floor-to-ceiling windows, a spacious chef’s kitchen and a larger outdoor area (complete with a firepit and private swimming pool). The decor is more minimalist and neutral, with several in-house designed furnishings. A skylight positioned above the bed allows for magical moon- and stargazing.
Cost From R3 900 per night (depending on season)
MAKE A RESERVATION

Facilities


  • 3 Sand Cabins, 3 Sun Cabins + 1 Luna Cabin (each sleeping two)
  • king-size beds
  • deep bathtub with valley views (plus outdoor shower in Sun Cabins)
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • spacious lounge with fireplace (in Luna + Sand Cabins)
  • large deck
  • gas and/or wood braai
  • wood-fired hot tub
  • outdoor firepit seating area (Sun + Luna Cabins)
  • private swimming pool (Luna Cabin)
  • bluetooth speaker/music player

Experience and explore

A continental breakfast (optional) is delivered to your cabin at 9am, with a focus on healthy, locally sourced ingredients. There is also an “honesty” shop and bar on site. Relax on the pool deck with a book and soak up the sun and sweeping views, or do a yoga class or book a massage.

Apart from direct access to the Kingfisher Waterfall, there are a number of excellent hiking trails in the area (Nima Lodge offers guided ones), or head down to beautiful Wilderness beach for long strolls. There’s canoeing on the lakes and rivers, a variety of forest adventures, catered picnics and a variety of good restaurants in the area.

A luxury hilltop lodge in Wilderness is a dreamy thing by virtue of the fact that it is a luxury hilltop lodge in Wilderness. While Nima Lodge certainly qualifies, that description hardly scratches the surface with all that it offers.

Distance from CT 5 hours
Child friendly? No
Pet friendly? No
Wifi? Yes
Where to find it 10 Mile Lane, Hoekwil, Wilderness, Garden Route
