title.rendered: La Chataigne: Stylish Self-Catering in The Franschhoek Winelands

content.rendered:
Near a tree, by a river, there’s a cottage in the woods. Well, there are five cottages actually… and they’re surrounded by orchards and vineyards… and mountains in the distance.

A boutique working wine farm in the beautiful Franschhoek valley, La Chataigne is home to five stylish self-catering cottages in a wonderfully intimate and relaxed environment.

Owned by Swedish-born Richard Parkfelt and his wife Julie – who have a passion for all things wine and decor – the original workers’ quarters and stables have been stylishly renovated and turned into monastic (and very chic) self-catering lodgings, perfect for all tastes and occasions. We particularly love the good-quality glassware and kitchen appliances (Smeg, no less), which elevate a great weekend away to one you won’t soon forget.

La Chataigne is the ideal spot to unwind, walk, play boules, chill by the pool and soak up the beauty of the surroundings. And, if you’re looking for a buzz, the town’s main drag – brimming with top restaurants, shops and galleries – is a mere five-minute drive away.

The lodgings

Guests have the choice of staying in one of five self-catering cottages spread across the farm. There are three riverside cottages: the newly renovated luxury one bedroom cottage Chestnut (sleeps two), family style 2 bedroom cottage’s Marron and Kastanje (each sleep four), and two Scandi-chic luxury one bedroom stable cottages, Blanc and Noir, which epitomise contemporary comfort and style.

Chestnut Cottage

  • one bedroom with a king-sized bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and bath
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • open-plan lounge with an indoor fireplace
  • outdoor patio with a braai and seating area
  • private swimming pool and garden
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R2 380 – R3 950 per night for the cottage (depending on season)

Marron Cottage

  • two bedrooms with king-sized beds (option of twin beds available)
  • two en-suite bathrooms (one with a shower, one with a bath)
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • open-plan lounge with an indoor fireplace
  • outdoor patio with a braai and seating area
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R1 850 per night for two adults (depending on season)
From R2 150 per night for three to four adults (depending on season)

Kastanje Cottage

  • two bedrooms with king-sized beds (option of twin beds available)
  • two en-suite bathrooms (one with a shower, one with a bath)
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • open-plan lounge with an indoor fireplace
  • outdoor patio with a braai and seating area
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R1 850 – R2 970 per night for two adults (depending on season)
From R2 150 – R3 400 per night for three to four adults (depending on season)

Blanc Cottage

  • one bedroom with a king-sized bed (option of twin beds available)
  • en-suite bathroom with a bath and shower
  • fully equipped kitchen with state of the art appliances
  • open-plan lounge with an indoor fireplace
  • outdoor patio with a gas braai and seating area
  • large deck with a private pool
  • TV with select DStv channel
  • air-conditioning
  • Nespresso machine
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R2 650 per night for the cottage (depending on season)

Noir Cottage

  • one bedroom with a king-sized bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a bath and shower
  • fully equipped kitchen with state of the art appliances
  • open-plan lounge with an indoor fireplace
  • outdoor patio with a gas braai and seating area
  • large deck with a private pool

Cost From R2 520 – R4 200 per night for the cottage (depending on season)

While you’re there…


Soak up the sun from the tranquil pool among the orchards, or take a stroll through the vegetable garden and vineyards before settling in with a glass of wine on your private patio.

There’s even a boules court for some light-hearted competition, and a selection of homemade treats and estate wine available for purchase. And, of course, the Franschhoek town centre is just seven kilometres away for those seeking a day trip.

Only Marron and Kastanje allow for young children, all other cottages permit children of 14 years and older. Chestnut can accommodate a baby in a cot on request.

title.rendered: De Zeven Guest Lodge: A Romantic Hideaway in Stellenbosch

content.rendered:
Perched on the majestic mountainside of the tranquil Banhoek Valley, which connects Franschhoek and Stellenbosch, lies De Zeven Guest Lodge – a stunning sojourn boasting awe-inspiring views of verdant vineyards in front, and fynbos-dotted slopes behind it.

It’s here where pristine surroundings create a splendid sense of seclusion, and an expertly executed mix of plush, contemporary-country decor and friendly, attentive service will make you wish your stay would last forever.

The lodgings

An intimate number of just 11 rooms offer utmost comfort, while a scattering of communal relaxation areas – all beautifully decked out and with floor-to-ceiling panes allowing the views to permeate – enhance the appeal.

Room features

  • four Pool Suites with large glass sliding doors overlooking the swimming pool and mountains beyond
  • seven Manor House rooms spread across the property, varying in size and splendour (select rooms feature an indoor fireplace and a private outdoor courtyard)
  • each room features a king-size bed, en-suite bathroom, tea- and coffee-making facilities, a hairdryer, air-conditioning, and complimentary wi-fi

Highlights

We woke to the sound of birds tweeting outside, before settling in for a delectable breakfast of homemade delights, served on the view-drenched deck: freshly brewed tea or coffee, oat and yoghurt pots, fresh fruit, pastries, cheese and cold meats, and a variety of hot breakfast options.

The panoramic swimming pool is the only place to be on hot summer days, followed by a destress session in the sauna, or a beauty and wellness treatment with a view, or in your room. The plethora of mountain-biking and hiking trails right on your doorstep makes this a nature lover’s dream.

Those looking to get out and about will enjoy the scattering of acclaimed wine farms in the area, offering wine-tasting, lunch, high tea or dinner. Stellenbosch central – lined with shops, restaurants, and galleries – is a short 10-minute drive away for those looking to immerse themselves in the historic town’s cultural centre.

All this and more make De Zeven Guest Lodge an escape we won’t soon forget.

Distance from CT 1 hour
Child friendly? No
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it Zevenrivieren Road, Stellenbosch, Western Cape

title.rendered: 7 Koppies: A Mountaintop Lodge with Killer Views in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
Reached by a winding dirt road that snakes its way through a 50-hectare privately owned fynbos reserve, this beautifully restored farmhouse fits so beautifully into its surroundings, it’s actually named after them!

Perched on a koppie (small hill), 7 Koppies is a tastefully quirky six-bedroom lodge in the Franschhoek Valley with spectacular, unhindered views of vineyards, the Simonsberg mountains and an eminently hikeable fynbos reserve – all of which are best enjoyed at sunset, with a glass of vino, from the edge of the 25-metre-long pool.

We arrived at midday, warmly welcomed by the affable house manager into a supremely stylish open-plan kitchen-dining-lounge area.

Think Haute Farmhouse where Arts and Crafts meets Cape Dutch, with playful pops of colour and cool accoutrements bringing it into the 21st century.

Valley of a thousand thrills

The voluminous Valley Suite, named for its impressive vistas, was our home-from-home for the weekend. Outside, a beautiful indigenous garden, designed by Franchesca Watson, seamlessly blends into the fynbos-dotted landscape beyond, while inside exquisite upholstery, quirky decor and raw materials of brick, stone and thatch have been judiciously combined to create a warm yet thoroughly modern suite.

My favourite feature was the view-drenched bay window; our son was enamoured with the double-volume shower, with its twin heads, that was big enough to store his bicycle!

Show-stopping sustainability

So, with hundreds of boutique boltholes popping up faster than you can say “Molton Brown toiletries”, what makes 7 Koppies stand out?

It’s not the spectacular setting – because, let’s face it, the Western Cape is incomparably beautiful; there is wonder to be found in every corner. Nor the impeccable design, generous service, and unique personality that this converted farmhouse oozes.

The X factor here is the authenticity of the setting – 7 Koppies is a working farm, home to beehives (from which gooey honey is harvested for breakfast), citrus trees (from which grapefruit and oranges are plucked daily and squeezed for the breakfast table), olive groves, a fynbos reserve (whose crops are used in the production of rooibos tea), a vegetable and herb patch (that provides bounty for the breakfast table), solar panels to heat the pool and utility water, and an eminently hikeable landscape right on your doorstep.

An ambrosial breakfast feast is served daily in the view-drenched dining-lounge, comprising Richard Bosman’s bresaola, Dalewood’s Boland cheese, freshly harvested honey, homemade yoghurt, freshly laid eggs… you get the idea.

Facilities

  • two en-suite rooms (The Garden Room, The Orchard Room, and Mountain Junior Suite)
  • two spacious en-suite suites (The Valley Suite and The Courtyard Suite)
  • one-bedroom cottage (Rockwood) with a kitchen, private pool and pool deck
  • all rooms feature king-size beds and organic cotton bedding
  • open-plan communal lounge, fully equipped kitchen and dining area
  • 25-metre-long lap pool
  • outdoor terrace
  • manicured gardens
  • daily service
  • daily breakfast
  • laundry service
  • house manager
  • butler

Serenity and style

7 Koppies is one of those rare properties that seamlessly combines style, comfort and country charm. When it was time to leave, we sat at the edge of the deck and watched the valley turn from bright orange to deep blue as the sun slipped away… savouring our last moments of silence and serenity that can only be found on top of a mountain in a private fynbos reserve…
Distance from CT 1 hour
Child friendly? Yes, for ages 13 and over
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it 7 Koppies Farm, R301, Wemmershoek, Franschhoek, Western Cape

title.rendered: Santé Private Villa: A Luxurious Wellness Retreat in Paarl

content.rendered:
You’ll find La Bella Vita Wine Estate off a quiet dust road between Paarl and Franschhoek, which is home to Santé Wellness Retreat & Spa – a one-of-a-kind haven focused on holistic health. In addition to this scenic villa, the estate is also home to a number of retreat suites so you can make the most of the beautiful surroundings and the spa offerings.

A premium member of Healing Hotels of The World (getaways for those who want a healthy, healing break with all the creature comforts), the retreat is owned by Graham and Ingrid Hindle who have created a world-class home-from-home – where everything from the bed linen in the suites to the products used in the spa, has been carefully considered to reflect a holistic, sustainable ethos.

The lodgings


No retreat would be complete without a luxurious pillow on which to rest your head, and Santé prides itself on giving its guests a cosseted home experience. In addition to 30 suites the luxurious private villa is the newest of the accommodation offerings – available to rent on an exclusive-use, or per-room basis.

Villa features

The Villa boasts beautifully decorated, elegant lounges and dining areas, as well as a private swimming pool with magnificent views over the indigenous gardens, surrounding vineyards and majestic mountains.

  • five individually-decorated suites
  • king-size bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a bath and shower
  • flat-screen TV with select DStv channels
  • in-suite safe/li>
  • air-conditioning
  • hairdryer
  • complimentary wi-fi
  • elegant indoor lounge and dining area
  • private swimming pool
  • garden, vineyard and mountain views
  • private chef (when exclusive use of the villa is booked)

  • What’s more…


    Santé Wellness Retreat & Day Spa, which is home to over 40 treatments in 17 different treatment zones, also boasts a one-of-a-kind Health Optimizing Clinic, Bio-Energy Centre, a gym with a yoga and Pilates studio, an indoor and outdoor pool, Jacuzzi, calming labyrinth and a well kitted-out conference centre.

    The on-site restaurant, Nourish (where breakfast is served each morning), offers guests wonderful, nourishing food that tastes as good as it looks. Executive chef Terrence Ford (former head chef of African Pride Crystal Towers Hotel) has created mouth-watering dishes free of sugar, dairy, gluten, preservatives, colourants and additives – yet you’d never believe it.

    A weekend (or week!) at Santé Private Villa is the perfect antidote to weary city dwellers, looking for the best kind of R&R.

    Sleeps 10
    Distance from CT 50 minutes
    Child friendly? No
    Pet friendly? No
    Where to find it La Bella Vita Wine Estate, Simonsvlei Road, Paarl, Western Cape

    Enquire Now

title.rendered: Waterline Villa: A Luxe Seaside Villa in Noordhoek

content.rendered:
Though it’s only a 40-minute drive from the city centre, the slow-paced suburb of Noordhoek seems more remote than it actually is, thanks in part to its dune-dotted landscape and a community-driven spirit that makes it an appealing destination for Capetonians – and out-of-towners – seeking to escape the daily grind.

And this luxurious villa, tucked between the white sands of Noordhoek Beach and the rugged beauty of Chapman’s Peak, is the kind of place where families and friends can immerse themselves in the sumptuous and serene surrounds.

Coastal comfort

The villa spans two storeys, with minimalist yet warm furnishings, and plenty of room for entertaining guests. Inside, are three lounges (one with a wood-burning fireplace), a library, a fully equipped kitchen and dining area.

Outside are a further two living areas, a rim-flow pool, sheltered gazebo, braai facilities, and views of Noordhoek Beach, the dunes and the surrounding landscape. The lush garden has a generous stretch of lawn – perfect for younger members of the family to let off steam.

The lodgings

There are four bedrooms (two en-suite), and four bathrooms (each with additional outside showers. All rooms have underfloor heating, with garden and mountain views.

Also on offer

  • flatscreen TV with Netflix
  • wireless audio system
  • Nespresso coffee machine
  • complimentary wi-fi
  • private chef (at additional cost), who handles grocery shopping, meal preparation, picnic arrangements, romantic dinners, and menu planning
  • spa treatments (at additional cost)
  • yoga sessions (at additional cost)
  • personal training options (at additional cost)
  • concierge service to help plan your daily itinerary

Good to know Thanks to its borehole and reverse-osmosis water filtration plant, Waterline Villa is 100% self-reliant when it comes to water. So guests need not worry about shortages here.

Village vibes

With the beach on one side, the village square a short drive away, and the beauty of Table Mountain National Park on your doorstep, there’s no shortage of adventures to be had in the area. We recommend:

  • Noordhoek Farm Village, where you’ll find The Foodbarn, a children’s playground, galleries and boutiques, Kristen’s Kick Ass Ice Cream
  • horse-riding on Noordhoek Beach
  • hiking trails
  • cycling on Chapman’s Peak
  • seal snorkelling at Hout Bay
  • Cape Point Nature Reserve
  • Boulders Beach penguin colony (about 20 minutes drive)

Sleeps 8
Child friendly? Yes, however, there is no safety net over the pool.
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it 11 Willow Street, Noordhoek, Cape Town

MAKE A RESERVATION

title.rendered: La Petite Ferme: A View-Drenched Hotel in The Franschhoek Winelands

content.rendered:
Situated in the exclusive resort town of Franschhoek, La Petite Ferme is a well-heeled destination, not least for its superb collection of small-batch wines that are produced on the property, but also for its breathtaking setting, farm-fresh food and, of course, warm hospitality.

An expansive lawn, dotted with roaming peacocks (and revellers enjoying good wine and even better views) lines the front of the property, with the charming, glass-fronted restaurant just behind it, where guests are welcome to enjoy daily breakfast and lunch, and dinner (served daily from November until April, and May to October on Fridays and Saturdays only).

And then there’s the hotel, whose nine elegant rooms all boast spellbinding valley, mountain and vineyard views from their perch on the northern slopes of the Franschhoek Mountains.

The lodgings

There are nine individually decorated rooms – five recently refurbished stylish Vineyard Suites, each with their own private pool overlooking the valley, and four Manor House Rooms that open onto a shared pool.

Florentin Suite

  • king-size extra-length bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and freestanding bath
  • private patio with a plunge pool
  • mini bar with complimentary wine
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • air conditioning and heating
  • smart TV
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R7 410 per room per night (depending on season)

Provençale Suite

  • king-size extra-length bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and freestanding bath
  • private patio with a plunge pool
  • mini bar with complimentary wine
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • air conditioning and heating
  • smart TV
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R7 410 per room per night (depending on season)

Africa Suite

  • king-size extra-length bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and freestanding bath
  • private patio with a plunge pool
  • mini bar with complimentary wine
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • air conditioning and heating
  • smart TV
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R7 410 per room per night (depending on season)

Moresque Suite

  • king-size extra-length bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and freestanding bath
  • private patio with a plunge pool
  • mini bar with complimentary wine
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • air conditioning and heating
  • smart TV
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R7 410 per room night (depending on season)

Léman Suite

  • king-size bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and freestanding bath
  • private patio with a plunge pool
  • spacious lounge
  • mini bar with complimentary wine
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • air conditioning and heating
  • smart TV
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R9 300 per room per night (depending on season)

Four Manor House rooms (La Petite, Library, Verandah, Bridal)

  • king-size or queen-size bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and freestanding bath
  • shared family-sized pool
  • private patio
  • mini bar with complimentary wine
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • air conditioning and heating
  • TV with a DVD player and select DStv channels
  • complimentary wi-fi

Cost From R2 635 per room per night (depending on season)

An abundance of attractions

There’s loads to do on the estate: leisurely walks, strenuous hikes, a complimentary guided vineyard tour where you can taste a selection of exclusive estate wines, mountain-biking with one of the estate’s fleet of bicycles and, of course, lounging by the pool.

The seasonal menu at the view-drenched restaurant offers an array of fresh, prettily plated starters, mouth-watering mains (the slow-roasted lamb is delicious), and decadent desserts prepared by head chef Kyle Norris, together with executive sous chef Stephen Raaff and Pastry chef Ester Labuschagne.

We can’t think of a better way to enjoy a weekend (or week) in the Winelands.

Distance from CT 1.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it Franschhoek Pass Road, Franschhoek, Western Cape

title.rendered: Botlierskop Private Game Reserve: A Luxury Safari Experience

content.rendered:
Halfway between the seaside towns of George and Mossel Bay, with views of the Indian Ocean on one side and the Outeniqua Mountains on the other, Botlierskop Private Game Reserve allows visitors to immerse themselves in the true beauty of the magnificent Garden Route.

The scenic reserve offers guests a selection of luxury accommodation, from a plush tented lodge, to breathtaking self-catering bush villas, and even an entire child-friendly village made for families traveling with little ones.

The diversity of wildlife in this malaria-free reserve ensures an authentic safari experience, with guests standing a good chance of seeing lion, elephant, buffalo and rhino (that’s four of the Big Five), as well as hippos, black impalas and a variety of bird life.

The lodgings

Spread out across the 4 200 hectare reserve, each one of the individually-designed luxury accommodation options vary in size, and suit all tastes and occasions. There’s also the Main Lodge boasting a lounge and open-plan restaurant – the Fire Place Restaurant. The outdoor wooden deck offers uninterrupted views of the bush and river.

Tented Lodge

These 21 tented suites are connected to the Main Lodge by raised wooden walkways, giving a sense of privacy.

Facilities

  • 21 tented suites (divided into Luxury, Deluxe, Family and Exclusive suites)
  • four-poster, king-size bed with mosquito net
  • private deck with outdoor seating and views of the Moordkuil River
  • en-suite bathroom with a deep oval bath and outdoor shower
  • minibar
  • in-room safe and telephone
  • tea-and coffee-making facilities
  • electric blanket
  • heating and air-conditioning
  • the Executive Tented Suite has a private splash pool
  • the Family Tented Suite has a spacious lounge converted to day beds when kids are sharing

Cost From R4 180 per person (full board, depending on season)

Bush Villas

Hidden in the fynbos, in a remote corner of the reserve, these eight self-catering bush villas overlook an active watering hole, and are the epitome of a luxurious stay in nature.

Facilities

  • two- and three-bedroom villas
  • king-size or twin bed and mosquito net
  • fully equipped kitchen with a dishwasher, fridge, oven and microwave
  • lounge with an indoor fireplace, satellite TV and dining room
  • private deck with an outdoor barbeque and dining area
  • plunge pool in select villas
  • tea-and coffee-making facilities
  • daily housekeeping

Cost From R4 800 per night, exclusive use only (depending on season)

The Village Lodge

This child-friendly, 16-bedroom lodge – situated on the northern side of the reserve – consists of a collection of new and old historic houses, with each house individual in style, but uniform in luxury and comfort.

Facilities

  • seven units (namely Rooidoekie Pod, Tommie’s Inn, Kasks Manor, Watermill Cottage, Kathu’s Post, Old Barn Manor, and Justice of the Peace)
  • king-size bed
  • en-suite bathroom with a shower and bath
  • private outdoor patio with seating area
  • indoor fireplace
  • minibar
  • electric blanket
  • air-conditioning

Cost From R3 300 per person (full board, depending on season)

Day Safari and Leisure Centre

An abundance of activities await at this scenic reserve, from guided game drives to horseback safaris, outrides and relaxing at the spa.

The lovely leisure area features a swimming pool for adults, a pool with water slides for the kids and a fountain pool for the little ones – not to mention a selection of newly-built shaded picnic areas on wooden decks at the dam.

Enjoy a delicious breakfast or lunch at the on-site restaurant, book one of the many activities on offer, or savour a wonderful pre-prepared picnic in one of the scenic relaxation areas as you soak up the stunning surrounds.

The bounty of flora and fauna and breathtaking views, coupled with spectacular spots to rest your head, makes Botlierskop Private Game Reserve a dream getaway.

Good to know From now until 20 September 2019, Botlierskop Private Game Reserve has a number of wonderful winter specials where you can experience a spectacular stay for less.

Distance from CT 4.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it Botlierskop Private Game Reserve, between Mossel Bay and George, Western Cape

title.rendered: The Plettenberg Hotel: World-Class Luxury by The Sea

content.rendered:
The bustling holiday town of Plettenberg Bay, along the scenic Cape Garden Route, is a popular holiday destination for locals and tourists. With the bars, restaurants and shops set against a backdrop of sweeping ocean views, it’s no wonder the town is first choice for those looking to escape the city and head straight for the sea.

As such, the pristine beaches and rocky shores are no stranger to fabulous lodgings waiting for guests to call them home for the weekend, and longer. But one such place – The Plettenberg – surpasses all the rest.

The Plettenberg is a grand five-star escape perched on a rocky headland, overlooking a long stretch of unspoilt beaches and fynbos-covered mountains. Part of The Liz McGrath Collection (of which The Cellars-Hohenort and The Marine Hotel are too), the seaside escape boasts 35 beautifully appointed hotel rooms, two family-friendly luxury villas, a sparkling pool, a stylish bar and a much-loved restaurant. It’s the perfect Plett stay, with an undeniable X-factor.

The lodgings


A choice of luxury units are available to suit all tastes and occasions, including two spacious family villas. The sophisticated, seaside-inspired decor echoes the location, and no matter which room you choose you’re guaranteed a wonderful stay.

Food for Thought

The Restaurant at The Plettenberg draws hotel guests and locals to the “The Collection restaurant with the best view.” The indoor dining section offers beautiful views of the pool and ocean, while the outdoor terrace is perfect for alfresco dinners, with mesmerising ocean vistas, especially at sunset.

Executive chef Kyle Macaskill and his team create innovative, sustainable seafood dishes, with a selection of meats and vegetables. They seek out local and seasonal ingredients for the freshest, tastiest meals. Signature dishes include Sesame-encrusted Norwegian salmon, served with black garlic risotto, citrus rocket salad, umami beans and an orange-teriyaki reduction, while carnivores can tuck into Klein Karoo springbok loin with fynbos cream potatoes, red cabbage marmalade, slow-roasted baby tomatoes, field mushrooms, string beans and a port reduction, with a carefully curated wine list completing the culinary experience.

Tasty Tipples

Fancy a pre-dinner cocktail or nightcap? The contemporary Sandbar cocktail bar and lounge is the perfect place to savour a selection of local, award-winning wines, bubbly, spirits and expertly mixed cocktails. Enjoy tea and coffee too, during the day, inside the modern interior, where glass, white leather, marble and natural oak finishes, combined with clever lighting, set the mood from afternoon to night.

While you’re there…

… visit the Fresh Wellness Spa for relaxing and rejuvenating treatments and packages for men, women and couples. All treatment products include natural and indigenous ingredients such as plant and marine-infused skin and body care products and massage oils.

Teetotalers will relish in the delectable high tea, featuring savoury bites such as smoked salmon trout, dill and cream cheese sandwiches, and Monkey Gland glazed beef and red onion mini skewers, as well as sweet treats of coconut sesame butter macarons, and tartlets, and heavenly freshly baked scones – all served with a fine selection of tea and coffee, or MCC and Champagne on request.

And, if you’re looking to simply relax and unwind, there are two lovely, laid-back lounges, namely the Blue Room and Garden Room (where high tea is served), that are just the place to do so!

If you can bear to leave the gorgeous hotel grounds, a mere stroll will take you to the bustling town centre of Plett, to an array of wonderful shops, laid-back restaurants and popular nightlife spots.

The Plettenberg has all the makings of the perfect South African seaside escape.

title.rendered: The Marine: Five-Star Seafront Lodgings in Hermanus

content.rendered:
Sun-drenched days, long swims in the sea, cliff-path walks and bounteous seafood platters… Holidays in Hermanus are the stuff lifelong memories are made of, especially when you’re staying at The Marine! This esteemed hotel’s enviable, yet discreet, cliff-hugging location, welcoming restaurants, and wonderful facilities make it a relaxing all-round destination – no matter what time of year you visit.

Owned by the late hotelier Liz McGrath, The Marine is one of three hotels in The Liz McGrath Collection (which also includes The Cellars-Hohenort in Cape Town and The Plettenberg on The Garden Route), which has become synonymous with culinary excellence, low-key sophistication and warm, professional service.

Set along the famed 10-kilometre-long cliff path, this 40-room property dating back to 1902, has had many revamps and renovations along the way, all of which are understatedly modern and upmarket – in a charming, old-world kind of way. Some of its wonderful facilities include a sheltered courtyard with a heated salt-water pool, two restaurants, a chic, stylishly appointed sea-facing lounge and bar area, and a spa – making it a destination in itself, where ocean views, fresh sea breezes and fresh-caught cuisine are the order of the day.

The hotel’s eclipsing feature is undoubtedly its prime position – a metre or so from the heady fynbos-infested cliff path that winds its way along the Walker Bay coast, offering some of the best whale-watching vistas in the world.

The lodgings


Taking its cue from its breathtaking setting, the decor in the hotel’s 40 rooms is serene, restrained and elegant. Rooms range from spacious premier suites with private terraces that open onto the cliff path, to smallish double rooms overlooking the courtyard.

Premier Suites

These 10 sumptuous suites are individually decorated, and boast panoramic views of the sparkling ocean.

  • one en-suite bedroom with a king-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • private sea-facing balcony
  • flat-screen TV with select DStv channels
  • welcome drink and fruit platter on arrival
  • complimentary minibar items
  • complimentary newspaper every morning
  • complimentary wi-fi
  • fluffy bathrobes and luxury bathroom amenities
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • bottled water at turndown
  • hot-water bottles during winter
  • personal in-room safe
  • hairdryer
  • secure parking
  • twice daily housekeeping services

Cost From R8 640 per room per night (depending on season, includes breakfast)

Luxury Double Rooms with Sea Views

These 10 luxury bedrooms boast awe-inspiring views of Walker Bay below, enabling guests to watch pods of dolphins and whales from the comfort of their bed.

  • one en-suite bedroom with a king-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • private sea-facing balcony
  • flat-screen TV with select DStv channels
  • welcome drink on arrival
  • complimentary minibar items

  • fluffy bathrobes and luxury bathroom amenities
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities

Cost From R6 080 per room per night (depending on season)

Double Rooms

Each one of these 20 ocean-inspired rooms offers comfort, serenity and understated luxury.

  • one en-suite bedroom with a king-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • private balcony
  • flat-screen TV with select DStv channels
  • welcome drink on arrival
  • complimentary minibar items
  • complimentary newspaper every morning

  • fluffy bathrobes and luxury bathroom amenities
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities

  • hot-water bottles during winter
  • personal in-room safe
  • hairdryer
  • secure parking
  • twice daily housekeeping service

Cost From R4 025 per room per night (depending on season)

Mealtimes at The Marine

The hotel boasts two unique restaurants, and a beautifully appointed sea-facing lounge and bar. A generous and impeccably presented breakfast buffet is laid out each morning in the light and bright Pavilion restaurant, where guests can select from a smorgasbord of pastries, cereal, fresh fruit, smoked salmon and cold meats and everything in between.

A metre or so from the famous cliff path is Origins, an elegant eatery that serves a variety of dishes crafted from indigenous and endemic ingredients which have come together to create a seasonal menu respectful of local cultures and regional flavours. The Chef’s Blackboard, chosen by head chef Tronette Dippenaar, offers three exciting new dishes each day.

And then there’s the Sun Lounge and Bar – the only place to be if you’re after a sunset cocktail, a pot of tea with scones, or a light snack.

Serene spa


The on-site Carchele Beauty Spa offers a wide range of relaxing massages and beauty treatments, including Black Pearl and Decléor facials, waxing, hand and foot therapy, body treatments, and couples massages, among others. There’s also a steam room and DermaLife capsule, with various programmes designed to detoxify, relax and rejuvenate.

Old-world hospitality


Perhaps it’s because we live in such a high-speed, high-volume world that my most abiding memories of The Marine are centred around the old-fashioned hospitality, and charming old-world touches that inhabit the hotel. A vase of lillies on the dresser in our bedroom, the creak of wooden floorboards in the upstairs corridors, the hound’s tooth carpets in the passages, a quaint internet lounge with piles of Time magazines, the handwritten note from house-keeping to tell me they’d run out of my preferred morning coffee, and the warmth and genuine enthusiasm of the staff.

It’s all these personal touches that make The Marine memorable. No matter what time of year you visit, it’s the kind of place where you can slow down, and let the stunning surrounds wash over you.

Distance from CT 1.5 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? Yes
Where to find it Main Road, Hermanus, Western Cape

title.rendered: The Cellars-Hohenort Hotel: Sumptuous Elegance in Constantia

content.rendered:
Part of the esteemed Relais & Châteaux hotel group, the five-star Cellars-Hohenort Hotel offers faultless luxury steeped in historic charm a mere 15-minute drive from Cape Town’s city centre.

Set in the picturesque Constantia Winelands, overlooking gardens, vineyards and Table Mountain in the distance, this beautiful escape is a veritable oasis, making the outside world seem irrelevant and far removed.

Home to two excellent restaurants, a sumptuous spa, beautiful wedding venue, and award-winning landscaped gardens, The Cellars-Hohenort hotel is a dream destination for a sojourn you won’t soon forget.

Delectable dining

The elegant Conservatory restaurant is a relaxed, country-style eatery with a 300-year-old oak tree at its centre, where a farm-fresh breakfast is served daily. Guests can also enjoy a delectable classic high tea, magnificent garden vistas, and a menu of simple yet perfectly executed dishes (overseen by head chef Paul Nash).

Relax and unwind

A footpath around the side of the main building takes you to the heavenly Fresh Wellness Spa that’s surrounded by a spectacular garden. Once inside, the relaxing interior and wonderful sensorial therapies will leave you feeling nothing relaxed and revived.

The lodgings


The hotel is home to 51 sumptuous decorated rooms and suites, each of which offer garden and mountain panoramas. Guests also have the option of staying in one of two luxury villas hidden away on the property, perfect for those seeking ultimate privacy.

title.rendered: Grootbos Private Nature Reserve: A Botanical Sanctuary in The Overberg

content.rendered:
In an ancient milkwood forest, surrounded by a sea of fynbos, Grootbos Private Nature Reserve is an extraordinary place where endless nature and sophisticated (unpretentious) luxury converge. With views right down to the whale-watching capital of Walker Bay, the reserve has been luring nature lovers, outdoor enthusiasts, gourmet travellers and young families back to its lair, long after the initial seduction has faded.

In addition to contemporary five-star accommodation in breathtaking surrounds, Grootbos offers guests a series of immersive travel experiences, peculiar to the reserve and this part of the world, all of which are underpinned by their ethos of regenerative tourism, sustainability and botanical conservation. Horse-riding, a fynbos safari and a tour of an ancient cave are just a few of the activities available.

The lodgings

There are two lodges: Forest Lodge and Garden Lodge in addition to two private villas. Both lodges are family-friendly, with a kids’activity room that has a big screen (and popcorn machine) for movies, a table tennis and foosball table, loads of books and games, arts and crafts, and the loveliest child-minders to look after your little ones while you enjoy sundowners on the terrace.

Forest Lodge

  • 16 luxury free-standing suites with fireplaces
  • private forest walkways
  • sweeping fynbos, forest, and ocean views
  • restaurant, lounge, boma, and barista bar
  • beauty salon and library
  • infinity pool

Cost From R11 480 per night for two people (depending on season)

Garden Lodge

  • landscaped gardens
  • panoramic ocean views
  • restaurant, lounge, boma and barista bar
  • beauty salon and library
  • swimming pool
  • pony rides, frogging, egg collecting on our organic farm on the property for little ones

Cost From R11 480 per night for two people (depending on season)

Two private villas

  • one six-bedroom villa
  • one four-bedroom villa
  • private chef, butler and nature guides
  • private swimming pool, cinema, wine cellar and gym

Cost Please enquire for rates.

Dream destination


In addition to luxe lodgings, Grootbos offers a range of unique and enriching experiences for guests to explore the surroundings. These include guided nature walks and hikes, horse-riding, bird-watching, unique botanical safaris, cooking classes and beauty treatments. Marine safaris, scenic flights, quad-biking, river cruises and whale watching can also be arranged by the hotel.

Grootbos Summer Sun Special After months of lockdown, Grootbos is running an unbelievable special: a five-star stay in a freestanding luxury suite, complete with breakfast lunch and dinner, and a string of selected activities, all for R3 950 per person per night (55% discount). The Summer Sun special runs from 11 January 2021 until 30 April 2021.

Distance from CT 2 hours
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No

title.rendered: Vrede en Lust: A Charming Countryside Stay Near Franschhoek

content.rendered:
At the foot of the Klapmuts Road, a short drive from the picturesque town of Franschhoek lies Vrede en Lust.

Originally established as a working wine farm more than 300 years ago, the estate now boasts a popular wine-tasting centre, four-star accommodation, conference and event facilities, a magical wedding venue, and a wonderful bistro-bakery called Lust.

Towering ancient oaks create a magnificent backdrop for the contemporary rooms and, together with attentive service, make this a stay you won’t soon forget.

The lodgings

The estate offers three accommodation options: a historical self-catering Manor House that sleeps eight; three picturesque Jonkmanshuis Cottages, each sleeping four; and 10 Luxury Vineyard Suites that sleep two each. The latter are perfect for travellers looking for a sophisticated stopover, while the Manor House and Cottages offer an inside look at the old-warm charm present on every corner of the estate.

Manor House

Dating back to 1688, this historical homestead sleeps eight guests in four bedrooms, and offers panoramic vineyard and mountain views.

Facilities:

  • three double bedrooms and one twin bedroom, all en-suite and individually decorated
  • large reception room, spacious lounge with fireplace, and formal dining room
  • view-drenched outdoor patio overlooking the valley
  • pool house with bar, dining area, bathroom and large patio
  • lush, landscaped garden with swimming pool
  • large outdoor boma with fire pit
  • fully equipped kitchen
  • complimentary wi-fi
  • air-conditioning

Cost From R22 950 per night, includes breakfast (exclusive use, depending on season)

Luxury Vineyard Suites

Surrounded by vineyards, with the spectacular Simonsberg mountain as the backdrop, these 10 suites offer guests a modern stay with breathtaking countryside views.

Facilities:

  • 10 suites with king-sized or twin beds, and an en-suite bathroom (five rooms have both a bath and a shower, and five have just a shower)
  • private patio with vineyard and mountain views
  • tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • a safe
  • small fridge
  • TV with select DStv channels
  • complimentary wi-fi
  • air-conditioning
  • hair dryer
  • bath and swimming towels provided

Cost From R2 295 per suite per night, includes breakfast (depending on season)

Jonkmanshuis Cottages

These three spacious cottages are perfect for a private, peaceful and picturesque countryside stay.

Marguerite Cottage

  • sleeps four guests in two en-suite double bedrooms
  • living room with a fireplace and flat screen TV with select DStv channels
  • fridge and microwave oven
  • access to a landscaped garden and shared pool
  • air-conditioning

Cost From R4 195 per unit per night, includes breakfast (depending on season)

Barbère Cottage

  • sleeps four guests in two en-suite double bedrooms
  • living room with a fireplace and flat screen TV with select DStv channels
  • small kitchen
  • access to a landscaped garden and shared pool
  • air-conditioning

Cost From R4 195 per unit per night, includes breakfast (depending on season)

Jacques Cottage

  • sleeps four guests in two en-suite double bedrooms
  • living room with a fireplace and flat screen TV with select DStv channels
  • fridge and microwave oven
  • access to a landscaped garden and shared pool
  • air-conditioning

Cost From R4 195 per unit per night, includes breakfast (depending on season)

While you’re there…

…enjoy a complimentary wine-tasting (or two!) at the Cellar Door Tasting Centre, open daily until 5pm. Breakfast is served at Lust Bistro and Bakery, which also offers lunch, take-home baked goods, and everything else in between – all made from seasonal, locally sourced ingredients. The smiling staff (headed by chef Jean Pierre Smith) and fresh decor add to the farmhouse-kitchen charm, while the outdoor play area is a great way to keep the little ones entertained.

Then there’s the nearby town of Franschhoek – brimming with art galleries, top-notch eateries, outdoor activities and many other exciting things to do – perfect for an outing with family or friends.

Whether you’re after a weekend away with loved ones, or are simply seeking a scenic reprieve away from it all, Vrede en Lust might be just the place you’ve been looking for.

Distance from CT 1 hour
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Where to find it Vrede & Lust Estate, intersection R45 & Klapmuts Road, Simondium, Western Cape
Please note Accommodation is closed until 12 July 2022 due to renovations.

title.rendered: Le Grand Jardin: A Wonderland-Inspired Villa in Stellenbosch

content.rendered:
At Le Grand Jardin, all paths – and there are many – lead to pleasure. I mean, how many holiday homes do you know of that have a life-sized Tintin rocket in the kids’ bedroom, a chandelier strung up over a giant-lily-pad pond, a jetty with a rowboat, two outdoor lounges with couches and fireplaces, a zipline, teepee and playground, an outdoor steam room built into a rock, a Jacuzzi under ancient oaks, a glass-enclosed atrium in the garden, a gin room (and a gym room), an underground wine cellar and tasting room, a terrace with a pizza oven and a treehouse perched above the giant lily pond, a pinball machine, library, drawing room… and the list goes on?

The answer is quite simply Le Grand Jardin, a playful yet palatial villa in the Stellenbosch Winelands that is exactly like nothing else! Part pleasure dome and part regal retreat, this Herbert Baker-style home is one of those rare properties that appeals to adventure-seeking four-year-olds and (70-year-old) style savants alike!

Children’s curious minds and boundless energy are catered for with the abundant activities and fantastical paraphernalia that will keep them entertained for hours, while grown-ups soak up and savour every drop of la dolce vita.

One villa. Endless experiences.

Amid days spent lounging by the pool, enjoying G&Ts in the outdoor lounge, and meals in the atrium and farmhouse kitchen, we went swimming in the eco-pool, paddled around the pond in a rowing boat, ziplined, watched an outdoor movie with blankets and buckets of popcorn, climbed onto the roof of the atrium, played soccer on the lawn and read stories in Tintin’s spaceship – which reminded us that one of the most enjoyable parts of being on holiday is acting like a child again.

Where substance meets style

And while there are bells and whistles aplenty, they’re matched by an exacting attention to designer detail and the utmost comfort, making stays here a feast for all senses.

In the historic homestead, the decor is a sophisticated mix of period pieces, plush upholstery and an exceptional collection of art, with funky wallpaper creating a cohesive canvas and blurring the lines between classic style and breezy playfulness.

The artful-curiosity vibe continues in the blue-hued gin room, with its saphire-coloured velvet couch and triptych by Lionel Smit. Next door is a copper-walled bar, with a wrought-iron staircase to an underground cellar.

And then there’s the Tintin-themed annexe, which needs to be seen to be believed. An oversized spaceship takes pride of place in the centre of the master bedroom that sleeps two adults and two children; its en-suite bathroom playing up the Hergé theme, with a mural of Tintin and Snowy and other surprising features that reveal themselves throughout your stay.

The lodgings

Facilities and services

  • Sleeps 15 (12 adults and three children)
  • Main house: three en-suite bedrooms, upstairs entertainment area, spacious downstairs living area, fully equipped bar, kitchen, formal dining room, office, library and outdoor terrace
  • Annexe: three en-suite pool suites, including a honeymoon suite, family room and queen-size room
  • a number of balconies and relaxation decks
  • all rooms feature complimentary wi-fi
  • large swimming pool
  • outdoor sauna and steam room
  • tree walks leading to a treehouse-inspired seating area
  • glass conservatory where breakfast is served each morning (this can also be booked for private functions, hosting up to 40 people)
  • dam and eco-pool
  • zipline
  • outdoor pizza oven
  • Jacuzzi
  • teepee
  • gym equipment

Le Grand Jardin propels the concept of a holiday villa into another orbit. If you want to disappear into a one-of-a-kind wonderland that ticks all the boxes – and then some – look no further.

Good to know Stay for 10 nights and only pay for eight, from now until 31 March 2020.
Distance from CT 45 minutes
Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Cost From R22 500 per night (depending on season, exclusive-use)
Where to find it Devon Valley Road, Stellenbosch, Western Cape

title.rendered: Sugarbird Manor: A Boutique Hotel with Cottages in Stellenbosch

content.rendered:
On the outskirts of Stellenbosch in the majestic Devon Valley lies Protea Heights, a 20-hectare protea and grape farm that’s home to Sugarbird Manor. Like a scene straight out of Under The Tuscan Sky, the stylish guesthouse perches at the top of a vineyard-covered hill, offering exquisite views of the valley – if it wasn’t for the Helderberg, Simonsberg and Jonkershoek Mountains looming in the distance, you’d be forgiven for thinking you were in the heart of rural Italy.

Inside, the contemporary and pared-down lounge and dining room are adorned with large art works by esteemed local artists, such as Verenka Paschke and Eleanor Turvey. And outside, two infinity pools, a sweeping garden, and numerous hiking trails evoke a private country paradise.

And if you’re looking to leave the farm, there are 12 nearby golf courses (!), a string of top-drawer restaurants and a handful of wonderful wine tours.

Grapes of worth

American owner Virginia Povall, a passionate vigneron, moved to Stellenbosch in 2008 with the purpose of growing grapes. In addition to her boutique guesthouse, Virginia creates her own wonderful wine at the farm, many of which have gained national traction among the local wine community. Her award-winning Botanica chenin recently won five stars in the Platter’s Guide, so be sure to ask for a tasting (and buy a few bottles) while you’re there!

Farm-fresh breakfasts

Each morning, breakfast is served in the dining room and outdoor patio, and begins with a fruit platter and homemade baked treats followed by your choice of hot breakfast. Real linen napkins, freshly squeezed orange juice, warm, knowledgeable service (complete with insider recommendations about the area) and spectacular valley views elevate it to the next level.

The lodgings

The property boasts nine luxury bedrooms of differing sizes, as well as four industrial-chic cottages with a fully equipped kitchen, lounge-dining area, and outdoor patio.

  • King-sized bed
  • Mountain and valley views

title.rendered: Serenity Villa: Killer Views + Every Mod-Con Under the Sun

content.rendered:
Situated on a quiet suburban street in the upmarket suburb of Camps Bay, Serenity Villa offers modern style, spacious living quarters, and a plethora of personalised services – all wrapped up in a scenic, luxury home.

Surrounded by striking fynbos, with 360-degree views of the ocean, Lion’s Head, the Twelve Apostles and Table Mountain, the villa oozes an undeniable sense of privacy and tranquil seclusion, despite its central location.

A mere five-minute walk away from the Camps Bay strip, dotted with buzzy bars and vibey restaurants, Serenity Villa is the ideal location for a luxe seaside sojourn.

Luxury living


The fully equipped villa is light, bright and spacious, and offers six stylish sea-, mountain-, and garden-facing suites. Boasting a number of exceptional features and facilities, the villa is the perfect spot for all-weather entertaining with family or friends.

Villa features

  • Six suites
  • Fully-equipped kitchen
  • Living room with an entertainment centre and TV
  • Wrap-around sun deck
  • Jacuzzi
  • Outdoor shower
  • Outdoor braai area
  • Outdoor lounge
  • Gym
  • Intimate screening room
  • Table tennis
  • Foosball

At your service


A number of personalised services are available to you during your stay: a fresh breakfast served daily that you can opt to enjoy outdoors or in, and a regular cleaning service to alleviate the stress that comes with living in a big home.

The villa can also arrange a butler, private chef, housekeeping and laundry services, bodyguards (for VIP guests), multilingual tour guides, and a driver for an additional cost.

With all of this taken care of, all you need to do is sit back and let Serenity wash over you.

Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No
Cost R25 000 – R32 000 per night (depending on season)

title.rendered: Escape to Leeu Estates for a Luxurious Winelands Experience

content.rendered:
On the slopes of the Dassenberg mountains lies a 68-hectare wine farm with an immaculately restored Manor House, whose six classically styled rooms offer sublime views of the surrounding vineyards, gardens and fynbos beyond. Owned by Indian entrepreneur Analjit Singh, this estate is one of three farms he acquired after a serendipitous visit to Franschhoek in 2010, during which he “instantly and instinctively knew this was it!”

The rooms

Dressed in subtle shades of taupe, coffee and cream, our luxuriously appointed room is the last word in classic, unadorned style, with billowy linen curtains, a thick-pile sisal carpet, luxurious cotton sheets and a marble-clad bathroom creating sumptuous accents. The subdued palette – no doubt chosen to blend discreetly into the surrounding landscape – is offset by Deborah Bell’s striking sculpture, Artemis and Dog I – III that takes centre stage on the manicured lawn below, adding the requisite drama and edge.

Lie of the land

In keeping with the principles of Vastu Shastra (the ancient Hindu science of architecture), space, sunlight, flow and function have been carefully considered on every inch of this landscaped estate – from the Bokkie Garden and serene spa, with its heated swimming pool to the fine-dining restaurants, wine-tasting studio and dinky spirit room where visitors can enjoy gin tastings for R150 – so that a sense of wellbeing prevails.

About the owner

Singh means lion in Sanskrit, which translated into Afrikaans is leeu. According to our breakfast waitress Stephanie Goliath, who took me on an impromptu tour of the estate, her 60-something employer is somewhat of a perfectionist. “He’ll arrive at the estate after three months away, and notice if the smallest thing is out of place. But he won’t ask someone to fix it; he’ll do it himself.” Forbes Asia reported that a total of US$35 million (R460 million) was invested into Mr Singh’s Franschhoek interests, which includes three wine farms, three hotels, five restaurants, a microbrewery and, most recently, a gin bar.

Above and beyond

The exceptional service. It feels as if every single member of staff is fluent in Lion Language, demonstrating a deep and intricate knowledge of the estate, Leeu Collection, and Mr Singh’s story. From waitrons and barmen to drivers and masseurs, the staff goes out of its way to make you feel special and at home.

X factor

Mr Singh’s impressive art collection – a mix of quirky, serious and thought-provoking works – that tastefully covers every corner of the estate. Beezy Bailey’s life-size royal blue Peace Man, allegedly Mr Singh’s favourite piece, presides over the reception area – a fitting welcome to this grand estate. Round the corner in the view-drenched lounge is a quirky piece by Daniel Firman, entitled Justine, of a woman leaning against the wall with her jersey over her head. I was so intrigued by its realness that I almost missed the (Irma) Stern and (Vladimir) Tretchikoff hanging by nonchalantly. The list goes on. (Art aficionados should ask to see the art directory, which includes an inventory of every item on the estate.)

Good to know

A three-minute complimentary shuttle takes you to Franschhoek’s pretty high street. Or, if you’re feeling energetic, cycle into town on one of the estate’s bicycles, which are free for use by guests.

Room rate From R11 700 per room per night (depending on season and room type; includes breakfast)
Where to find it Dassenberg Road, Franschhoek, South Africa.

title.rendered: La Rive Franschhoek: A Private Villa With A Storybook Garden

content.rendered:
If Harry and Meghan were to honeymoon in Franschhoek, this tranquil hideaway – set on a one-hectare estate straight out of Pride and Prejudice – would be the perfect spot. Its discreet location – just one block from the sidewalk cafés, galleries, award-winning restaurants and everything else that makes Franschhoek tick – is ideal for those seeking under-the-radar splendour (without lifting a finger).

Exquisitely decorated in a stylish mix of curated antique furniture and contemporary art, this six-bedroom manor house feels like the private home of a couple of bon vivants, which is exactly what it is – the owners, who have houses in the US, UK, and Franschhoek, travel extensively and are avid collectors of art and antiques.

The rooms


Amour and Lace

Each of the six individually decorated en-suite bedrooms has its own distinct character, but all overlook the sparkling swimming pool, which takes pride of place in main section of the garden. Our manorhouse suite (the room the owners use when they’re in the country) is a salubrious mix of Victorian, Cape Dutch and Art Deco furniture and decor, with a contemporary colour palette (evident in the upholstery and soft furnishings) bringing it into the 21st century. We had the pick of the house, but chose this room for its double vanities, underfloor heating in the bathroom, deep-soaking tub and capacious dressing room – not to mention doors that open onto the terrace and enchanting garden beyond. (But, actually, there isn’t a bad room in the house.)

Lie of the land

Dating back to 1860s, when the land the house stands on was allegedly surveyed, the U-shaped home is arranged around a magnificent garden and swimming pool, with deep verandahs and a covered terrace providing the perfect space for lazy lunches and late-night soirées.

Serviced by a borehole, the garden is an enchanting combination of overgrown ferns and beautifully manicured lawns, with Koi ponds, a vegetable garden, interesting water features and a Dylan Lewis sculpture adding interest. No wonder it’s been the site for many a film shoot and wedding celebration.

Above and beyond

We arrived at the villa on one of those magnificently sunny autumn days in Franschhoek, to be greeted by name (our three-year-old son included) by the ineffably lovely Wayne McLachlan, the villa’s chef/ manager/ host/ etc etc. After enjoying a “glass of shampoo” in the exquisite living room, Wayne gave us a tour of the grounds, and very patiently allowed our son to tinkle the ivories on the grand piano.


Hamish Niven

While the others went to explore the Wonderland-like grounds, I made my way to the outdoor verandah – glass of bubbly in one hand and a bowl of just-roasted cashews in the other. With a fire roaring in the background, and an Eden-esque view in front, I could’ve been anywhere in the world. There’s something about an outdoor verandah that signifies the ultimate luxury.


Amour and Lace

La Rive is one of those unforgettable escapes – just as suited to couples toasting their their new life as a twosome as it is to families and friends celebrating a special occasion. There’s something about being a guest in someone’s home (rather than a nameless face in a big-chain hotel) that makes staying in a privately owned property an irreplaceable experience.

title.rendered: Domain at La Clé Village: Casbah Style in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
Meaning “the key to the mountain”, La Clé Village is a breathtakingly beautiful countryside retreat for exclusive use, where personalised service and uninterrupted tranquility are a given.

Domain is the last word in cosseted comfort.

A mere five-minute stroll from Franschhoek’s buzzy high street, the luxurious lodgings – inspired by North and East African design – are nestled among blossoming orchards and rolling vineyards, offering seclusion in stylish surrounds.

Available on an exclusive-use, a few nights here will have you feeling like the queen (or king) of your very own, very chic countryside estate.

A modern retreat

The interior at Domian resembles a Marrakech riad (if Marrakech had vineyards on its doorstep). Bold, patterned upholstery, brightly coloured furniture and chic, modern decor create a sense of warmth and comfort is this three-bedroomed villa, while a large pool, spacious garden and sweeping terrace offer an outdoor oasis – with magical mountain views.

Villa features

  • 3 en-suite Rooms
  • Lounge with flat-screen TV and select DStv channels
  • Pool and garden area
  • Terrace
  • Complimentary wi-fi
  • Room safe

title.rendered: Grange at La Clé Village: Historic Farmhouse Beauty in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
Meaning “the key to the mountain”, La Clé Village is a breathtakingly beautiful countryside retreat that’s home to four individual Village houses, where personalised service and uninterrupted tranquility are a given.

A mere five-minute stroll from Franschhoek’s buzzy high street, Grange villa – like the other luxury homes on the estate – is nestled among blossoming orchards and rolling vineyards in the heart of the Franschhoek Valley.

Available on a per-room or exclusive-use basis, the peaceful surrounds and luxurious lodgings make this charming Village house a wonderful space to call your home for the duration of your stay.

Farmhouse elegance

High ceilings, deep verandahs, wooden floorboards and rich, warm furnishings will transport you to a bygone era. It’s hard to imagine that this magnificent villa was once a storage barn. Each of its three en-suite bedrooms has its own private patio with magical garden views, while the large open-plan kitchen, upstairs sitting area, library, garden and pool is for use by Grange guests.

The library, swimming pool, and bicycles are at your disposal, and there’s also the option of a personalised dining service and private chef on request.

Villa features

  • 3 suites
  • lounge with flat-screen TV and select DStv channels
  • private patio (outside each room)
  • pool and garden area
  • terrace
  • free wi-fi
  • daily servicing
  • concierge services

title.rendered: Galerie at La Clé Village: An Avante-Garde Villa in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
Meaning “the key to the mountain”, La Clé Village is a breathtakingly beautiful countryside retreat that’s home to four individual Village houses, where personalised service and uninterrupted tranquility are a given.

The most exclusive – Galerie – is an art gallery-inspired private villa with a personality that packs a punch.

Located on the scenic estate, a mere five-minute stroll from Franschhoek’s buzzy high street, the artistically styled villa is nestled among blossoming orchards and rolling vineyards, which echo the imaginative decor within.

Available for exclusive-use only, this fully serviced two-bedroom villa is the answer to all your personalised (and arty) getaway dreams.

An envious escape

As the name suggests, the interior is inspired by a contemporary art gallery, where handpicked abstract pieces line the walls of the entrance, while pops of bright colour and bold patterns create an interesting contrast to the minimalist charcoal walls.

With a private pool, outdoor terrace, garden and open-plan kitchen all to yourself, all that you need is on your doorstep.

Villa features

  • Two king-size en-suite bedrooms Lounge with flat-screen TV and select DStv channels
  • Fully equipped kitchen
  • Private garden terrace
  • Private pool
  • Free wi-fi
  • Room safe
  • Air-conditioning
  • Underfloor heating
  • Heated towel rails
  • Daily servicing

title.rendered: Manoir at La Clé Village: A Luxurious Homestead in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
Meaning “the key to the mountain”, La Clé Village is a breathtakingly beautiful countryside retreat that’s home to four individual Village houses, where personalised service and uninterrupted tranquility are a given.

Manoir homestead is one such luxury home.

A mere five-minute stroll from Franschhoek’s buzzy high street, nestled among blossoming orchards and rolling vineyards, the peaceful two-bedroom homestead is available for exclusive use.

Reminiscent of a traditional, exceptionally elegant French Manor House, Manoir boasts a magnificent sense of heritage and authenticity that’s rare in modern accommodation. Here, guests have full access to a lounge, dining area, pool, and garden, while being surrounded by the true beauty of the Franschhoek landscape.

A sophisticated sojourn



In addition to the main reception, dining and library areas, the house features two en-suite bedrooms, tasteful decorated with antique furniture and warm finishes, and each featuring their own private terrace overlooking a beautiful garden and vineyards.

The libraries, swimming pools, and bicycles are at your disposal, and there’s also the option of a Chef’s Table dinner on a Monday, Wednesday, and Friday at the neighbouring La Clé Lodge.

The garden suite

  • King-size four-poster antique bed
  • Private patio
  • Extra large en-suite bathroom with double shower and bath
  • Walk-in dressing room
  • TV with select DStv channels
  • Tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • Complimentary wi-fi
  • Pool and garden terrace
  • Dining area
  • Lounge with flat-screen tv and select DStv channels
  • Room safe
  • Air-conditioning
  • Heated towel rails
  • Complimentary snacks
  • Private parking
  • Daily servicing
  • Concierge services

The petite room

  • King-size bed (can be converted to twin beds)
  • Private patio
  • En-suite bathroom with shower
  • TV with select DStv channels
  • Tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • Complimentary wi-fi
  • Pool and garden terrace

  • Room safe
  • Air-conditioning
  • Heated towel rails
  • Complimentary snacks

  • Daily servicing
  • Concierge services

Child friendly? On request (roll-away bed costs extra)
Pet friendly? No
Sleeps 4

title.rendered: Drayton Farm: A Secluded Self-Catering Cottage in Caledon

content.rendered:
Located just outside Caledon, this farm dates back to the 1700s when it was a stop along the old wagon route, and holds all the charm a quaint slice of history should. With only two accommodation units on the entire property, which itself is situated far from town crowds, this stay is one of true peaceful seclusion where your only neighbours are the nearby mountains, and the only sounds you’ll hear are from the chirping birds and gurgling stream that flows past your cottage.

Both of the cottages are fully equipped for the whole family, and guests can choose to stay in either Piet-my-Vrou Cottage (a classic farmhouse that hosts up to six), or in Piet-se-Kinders – two beautifully-converted shipping containers with four double rooms and a coffee station with two showers and toilets (not en-suite), and a fully-equipped kitchen. It’s a perfect fit for a family holiday away from it all.

Cosy cred Indoor fireplace, outdoor spot for fires and braais, fully clad beds with warm bedding, indoor lounge and dining area, and a sheltered verandah.

Onsite and nearby attractions

  • Nature walks trail to waterfall
  • Bird-watching at the dam and stream
  • Mountain-biking trail
  • Wine-tasting in nearby Hemel-en-Aarde Valley
  • Golf, hot springs and spa treatments at the nearby Caledon Spa or Arabella Hotel

title.rendered: Luxury Tented Bush Camping at !Khwa Ttu in Yzerfrontein

content.rendered:
Just over an hour outside of Cape Town, this breathtaking place gets its name from (and is inspired by) the ancient San culture. In addition to a selection of luxury camping units, the lodge also offers a more rustic experience for tranquil evenings spent sleeping under the night stars.

Facilities

  • Bush Lodge has 4 large tents, each of which sleeps 2 people, has a lounge area, en-suite toilet and shower, covered outdoor deck with a small kitchenette, and a private braai area
  • Bush Camp offers more basic facilities, with 5 tents (each sleeping 2-4 people), communal bathrooms, a central kitchen and a boma with a fireplace
  • Both campsites are solar-powered
  • Firewood is available for purchase

Activities

  • Game drives
  • A walk in nature to learn about the San people’s tracking skills
  • A photo exhibition, and the screening of an ethnographic film
  • Farmhouse restaurant
  • Herbal tea tastings
  • San language sessions
  • Cycling and walking trails

Pet policy Pets are welcome.

Check availability + Book Direct

title.rendered: Driehoek Guest Farm: Tranquil Camping in the Cederberg

content.rendered:
The region provides the ultimate escape from city life and, while the farm is a treasure in its own right, it also serves as a perfect base for exploring what is one of the country’s most hauntingly beautiful landscapes.

Distance from CT 3.5 hours

Facilities

  • Communal ablution facility with toilets, hot showers and a scullery
  • Limited bedding is available by arrangement (guests are encouraged to bring their own bedding and toiletries)

Activities

  • Explore the Cederberg on one of the farm’s many walking trails, passing by rock formations, waterfalls and natural pools where you can enjoy a refreshing dip
  • Hiking trails in the surrounding mountains (for hardier types)
  • Driehoek’s assortment of amicable farm animals (kids will love them)

Pet policy Pets are not allowed.
Good to know Although the campsite is open all year round, camping in the area during winter is not recommended by management, as winters in the Cederberg are quite severe. However, there are also chalets on site, warmed by fireplaces, that make for a great winter getaway.
Insider tip For those who prefer to visit the site during quiet periods, it’s recommended to visit during the week, before or after long weekends and school holidays. For example, the second half of January, or any time during November.

title.rendered: The Riverstone House in Wolseley: A Farm Stay on The Breede River

content.rendered:
Situated on a working blueberry and pear farm on the banks of the Breede River, The Riverstone House in Wolseley is a mere 90-minute drive from Cape Town, but offers hard-to-beat seclusion – you’ll feel like you’re a million miles away.

This cosy house features all the comforts of a home-away-from-home, with the added benefit of being on Nature’s doorstep.

The shaded front stoep leads onto a sunny patch of lawn in the front of the house – ideal for the kids and pooches to roam free. The Breede River just below the front garden is accessed by a short flight of steps, and beckons on sweltering summer days. In winter, fireside board games in the lounge, fuelled by hot chocolate and rusks, are the stuff fun-filled family weekends are made of.

Family affair

Four bedrooms and two spacious bathrooms (with showers and baths) accommodate up to 10 people comfortably. The modern, open-plan kitchen and living area open onto a spacious patio, with views of endless nature at every turn. A washing machine, dryer, dishwasher and fully equipped kitchen cupboards ensure comfortable, no-fuss family living.



Home features:

  • Four bedrooms (two twin and two double)
  • Open-plan living area
  • Front and back patio
  • Fully equipped kitchen
  • Fireplace
  • Fans
  • Washing machine
  • Tumble dryer
  • Toiletries
  • Tea- and coffee-making facilities
  • All linen and towels supplied

While you’re there…

Should you tire of splashing in the river, lounging on the patio and enjoying festive family feasts (we can’t imagine you would!), take a day trip to one of the neighbouring towns (Tulbagh, Ceres and Slanghoek are a short drive away), explore the Ceres Valley on the Ceres Railway, get your adrenaline pumping on the Ceres Zipline, go horse-riding or mountain-biking on the nearby trails, visit one of the surrounding wine farms for a tasting or picnic, or go berry-picking on the farm during season.

With all this the doorstep of this wonderfully comfortable holiday home, The Riverstone House is all you need for a fabulous getaway.

Good to know They offer pet-sitting on request

title.rendered: The Post House: A Reimagined Boutique Hotel in Greyton

content.rendered:
A short hour-and-a-half drive from Cape Town lies the small town of Greyton, a charming village that has changed little since its establishment in 1854, despite becoming a prominent tourist destination over the past four decades.

Dubbed South Africa’s “Little England”, it’s home to a beautiful nature reserve, old-world architecture, a slew of antique and junkshops and, of course, a collection of enchanting spots to stay – the most renowned of which must be The Post House.

You may have heard of it, since it’s one of the oldest buildings in Greyton, dating as far back as 1860 when it operated as a trading post. It’s seen several owners, the most recent of whom are John and Janet Higginson, who took over in 2018, and have breathed new life into its walls. A former model and pastry chef, Janet brings a unique set of skills to the table, as does John, a property developer.

Reimagined as a luxurious boutique hotel with an easy but modern style, complete with a beautifully restored colonial style bar, a private pool, on-site restaurant, pub and trendy coffee shop selling Deluxe coffee, The Post House offers all-round comfort – all you really need for a restful weekend getaway.

Country chic


Like stepping into a passage between past and present, The Post House’s fascinating history is palpable in its architecture, which is perfectly juxtaposed with the contemporary decor and furnishings evident in the sixteen newly renovated rooms (with all the comforts of modern amenities).

Each has been individually decorated, and range in size and facilities, but the contemporary-cool interior style is consistent throughout, with bright pops of colour and a warm, comfortable atmosphere. We love the planet-friendly Healing Earth toiletries in each room (and that biodegradable products are used to clean the bathrooms).

One Honeymoon Suite

These offer an ideal romantic space to indulge in uninterrupted luxury, and feature:

  • Double storey
  • Private courtyard and balcony
  • Private lounge
  • Fireplace
  • Copper-rimmed spa bath
  • Double shower
  • Daily servicing
  • King-size bed
  • Fully stocked mini bar
  • Vanity station
  • Room safe
  • Toiletries
  • Hairdryer
  • Temperature control
  • Complimentary coffee, tea, bottled water, and biscuits
  • Electric blankets

Cost From R1 800 per night (depending on season)

Six Classic Rooms

These epitomise laid-back country living, and feature:

  • Garden views
  • Patio seating
  • Daily servicing
  • King-size bed (can be made into twins)
  • Bath/shower in one
  • Nespresso machine
  • Fully stocked mini bar
  • Vanity station
  • Room safe
  • Toiletries
  • Hairdryer
  • Temperature control
  • Complimentary coffee, tea, bottled water, and biscuits
  • Electric blankets

Cost From R1 350 per room per night (depending on season)

Seven Deluxe Rooms

These are all individually decorated, and grant the feeling of a true home away from home, and feature:

  • Garden views
  • Patio seating
  • Daily servicing
  • King-size bed
  • Free-standing Victorian bath
  • Shower
  • Nespresso machine
  • Fully stocked mini bar
  • Vanity station
  • Room safe
  • Toiletries
  • Hairdryer
  • Temperature control
  • Complimentary coffee, tea, bottled water, and biscuits
  • Electric blankets

Cost From R1 500 per room per night (depending on season)

One Family Suite

This suite is the perfect fit for a family with kids, and features:

  • Two bedrooms
  • Two bathrooms
  • Garden and pool views
  • Patio seating
  • TV with select DStv channels
  • Microwave and small fridge
  • Fireplace
  • Daily servicing
  • King-size beds (can be made into twins)
  • Bath/shower in one
  • Nespresso machine
  • Fully-stocked mini bar
  • Vanity station
  • Room safe
  • Toiletries
  • Hairdryer
  • Temperature control
  • Complimentary coffee, tea, bottled water, and biscuits
  • Electric blankets

Cost From R1 500 (depending on season)

All you need and more


A mere stumble away from the comfort of your suite is the popular on-site restaurant, which serves a selection of wholesome country-style dishes. Coffee Pod, the new on-site coffee shop, is a top choice for freshly brewed artisanal cuppas, decadent pastries and a great vibe.

Whether you’re in the mood for a romantic getaway, a family break, or a weekend away with friends, The Post House in Greyton offers calm country comfort.

title.rendered: Holden Manz Country House: An Art-Lover’s Oasis in Franschhoek

content.rendered:
Situated on a small wine estate at the top of the Franschhoek Valley, this is not your average French-inspired Franschhoek hotel… Au contraire… The European owners (German-born Migo Manz and British native Gerard Holden) have elegantly combined contemporary African art, South African warmth and hospitality, and European design aesthetics to create a unique and tranquil Cape Dutch-style guesthouse.


And, in addition to the luxe lodgings, the estate is also home to a state-of-the-art winery, tasting room and restaurant, outdoor swimming pool and serene spa and yoga studio.
The pitch-perfect interiors – dressed in an impressive collection of contemporary African art, and a combination of modern furniture and antique finds – reflect the owners’ passions; it’s hardly a surprise to find out that they own an eponymous art gallery on Franschhoek’s main road where you can purchase striking local art.




The rooms

There are five beautifully appointed guest rooms that boast magical views of the mountains and vineyards outside. Though the house accommodates a maximum of 10 people, you might never encounter another guest during your stay, as there are sumptuous sofas tucked away in various nooks and crannies, where curling up with a book from the floor-to-ceiling bookshelf is obligatory.

Four King Suites

  • Orchard, vineyard and mountain views
  • Large balcony
  • Extra-length king-size bed
  • En-suite bathroom with separate bath and shower
  • Air-conditioning
  • Underfloor heating
  • TV with select DStv channels and satellite television
  • Breakfast included

Cost From R5 700 per person sharing (depending on season)

One Classic Suite

  • Estate, vineyard and mountain views
  • Large balcony
  • King-size bed
  • En-suite bathroom with shower only
  • Air-conditioning
  • Underfloor heating
  • TV with select DStv channels and satellite television
  • Breakfast included

Cost From R4 800 per person sharing (depending on season)

Service is warm and attentive (never intrusive) and, with a pool, spa and yoga studio on the property, we can’t imagine why you’d want to leave.

Child friendly? Yes
Pet friendly? No

title.rendered: Franschhoek Country House & Villas: Postcard Provence

content.rendered:
With the heady scent of lavender wafting through the air, rose bushes and lemon trees at every turn, and a stately Provençal-esque villa, you might think you’ve landed in the south of France when you arrive at Franschhoek Country House & Villas – a small luxury hotel in the heart of the Franschhoek Valley.


Set against the rugged Franschhoek mountains, the 26-room manor house is located a brisk 15-minute walk from Franschhoek’s bustling high street, with its sidewalk cafés, art galleries, upmarket boutiques and interior shops.



But, with award-winning Monneaux restaurant on the grounds, a spa, two beautiful swimming pools, rambling gardens, attentive service and peaceful surrounds, you might not ever want to leave the estate…

Suite serenade

Dating back to 1860, the original manor house features 14 rooms: six standard rooms, five luxury rooms, and two garden cottages, as well as 12 luxurious villa suites – all of which include breakfast.

Twelve Villa Suites

Utterly sumptuous, Provençal-style lodgings with high ceilings and exposed beams, a roomy lounge and entertainment area, two balconies with chaise-longues and breathtaking views of the vineyards and valley beyond. Say no more.

  • Dining area
